My husband and I found this place just driving by about five years ago on Valentines day. Its hard to see if your not looking for it, but I'm super happy to have found the place! I love their happy hour menu because you can have a small taste of the entire menu almost, from the short rib martini to the wontons with goat cheese or the tuna with crispy rice, all of the meals prepared are amazing. My favorite thing is that the staff seems to be like family. We were even told that they close for a week or so in August I believe and the owner fishes for fresh fish for his restaurant, and it also give the staff a vacation, I've never heard of a place doing that but I really like the concept. There are fresh herbs growing out front of the restaurant and the bar is stocked with amazing wines and always a friendly bartender, they know us by name! At my last visit my entr√©e of short rib, which I love to death, was a bit chewy, didn't really fall apart like usual and seemed to be a larger hunk of meat than I'm use to which is the only reason I'm giving it four stars and not five. I always have the fear that like most Vegas restaurants quality and care start to decline so I hope the short rib wasn't a sign of that, but for so many consistent years of amazing food Ill give Todd a break and definetly go back soon!

My step-mom and I both had a great experience dining at Todd's. The atmosphere was great, I would definitely go on date to this restaurant. The servers were very polite and professional which you don't see very often anymore. The food was very good. We had the Halibut and the spinach salad with blueberry dressing. Very refreshing. The price's were a little spendy but overall I had a good experience.

Todd's remains one of my favorite places in Henderson!

I believe I've been hooked ever since our first visit.   Service here continues to provide a friendly atmosphere.  Rodney, who was our most recent waiter, kept a courteous and attentive persona.  Drinks were always filled promptly along with the delicious bread basket.  

For an appetizer they had the cajun shrimp and grits on special.  This was great! The shrimp had a very succulent flavor accompanied by the buttery creamy grits.  I'd order this again.  I had the Seared Sea Scallops over Mushroom Mash for my main attraction.  Lightly seared and perfectly cooked.  I was so happy with my choices so far that I was going to get dessert!   Snickerdoodle bread pudding anyone?  I will admit it's not the first time I've ordered this dessert and I promise it won't be my last.  My husband doesn't like raisins so luckily for him there aren't any in their bread pudding.  This makes it perfect for us to share.  It's definitely large enough so you won't feel the guilt of eating the whole thing.  

I will continue to be a loyal customer of Todd's.  It's always a pleasure dining here!
It was good! We are four foodies from San Jose, and we thought the service was great, the food was good, and the wine list was awesome. Recommended.
I am a local and this is one of my top very few restaurants.  It is so good, every time we go.  Also it is priced well and no strip / hotel drama too .

We had scallops, mahi mahi (special) and the short ribs. 
The short ribs were outstanding, very well done and wonderful flavor. the scallops were perfectly cooked with a sweet glaze and very complex flavor.  The only problem with the scallops is only 4 scallops, seemed kind of a rip off, but the flavor was there. The Mahi Mahi was a off menu special and we thought kind of ordinary. We had the goat cheese wontons for a appetizer, they were flavorful and went perfect with the raspberry sauce. We also had a grumpy salad which seemed to be the only thing we had that we didn't love. Overall, very good food. I want to go back for the fiery skirt steak. Service was excellent and very quick even though it was a friday night. Make reservations.

Date night - Incredible experience. The ambiance, the service, the food, the wine and the dessert. Had the skirtsteak and jalapeno mashed...my date had the lamb...we both were in heaven from start to finish...speaking of finish, the creme broulees were wonderful and perfectly done.  Bellisimo!!

Finally went to this place after many recommendations and it met my requirement of a craveable item.   The menu didn't sound as appealing as it was but the spicy skirt steak atop a bed of fries was pretty tasty and unique.
All I have the say is this place is a hidden gem. We love coming here and the food has always been perfect and service is always great! We always recommend this place to visitors.

We went with friends for a quiet evening of good food and good conversation. The restaurant has only 2 rooms. the front room by the door with a bar and the back room. We chose to eat in the back room because it is quieter and a little bit more private. Our waiter came almost immediately to get our drink orders and to explain the specials. This was very nice because on Wednesday nights they have no corkage fee. We were able to bring our own bottles of wine and drink our own selections. I ordered the ahi tuna with wasabi mashed potatoes. They serve the tuna seared rare. The tuna was extremely tender and very flavorful. Perfect! My wife had the salmon special. Also very flavorful. A little over cooked but not spoiled. Our friends had one of the beef specials. He raved about it the entire night. We ordered two desserts to be shared by the four of us. We had a bread pudding and a fruit cobbler with ice cream. One dish was better than the next. A perfect way to end the meal. Overall, excellent ambience, service, and food quality. You couldn't ask for more.

I saw this restaurant on TV as being rated highest by the CHEFs in Las Vegas, so I was eager to try it.  Both my husband and I go to Vegas several times a year on business and are always looking for that "Unique" restaurant to be able to share with clients and to impress the boss.  After putting the finishing touches on our space at the World Market Center, we went to Todd's.  We each had a different appetizer, salad, entree', and desert, and all was the best we had ever had, right down to the Lemon Drop cocktail.
My husband took his clients and boss and while there was some hesitation before tasting, (located in a strip mall), that quickly was replaced with extreme satisfaction for the ease of access and awesome meal.   Now the boss requests to go back to "that really great restaurant off the strip".  It is so nice to be able to entertain clients with pride knowing they will have a fabulous dining experience.
My husband and I also drive there from Riverside County, Ca a few times a year as well, just to relax and enjoy the food!  Can't miss!!

Had a fabulous dinner here recently.  Was my second time in and was just as good as the first.  I brought some co-workers who were in from out of town.  It did not disappoint.  From the Chef's appetizer combo that was offered to our table because of our number (six of us), to the deserts that were shared among the party, it was  a perfect night of fabulous food and great service.  I highly recommend the short ribs.... AMAZING!!!

one of the best neighborhood gems anywhere - and I've lived in SF and LA...gotta try the goat cheese won tons to start and go from there...decent wine list, killer appetizers and entrees (scallops are my favorite)...They do first rate seafood but does lamb chops and steaks as good or better than anywhere...dining room is a bit odd and decor is mediocre but the food is the star here so who cares...if you plan on going on a weekend night or any special occasion make reservations...plus they usually are running behind...just a tip don't get a booth - they are uncomfortable.  If they ever change out the decor and seating they get 5-stars.

Went for Valentines Day. I don't usually eat steak or seafood but I got it. Soo good! I love the fish bowls on the table with bread. Everything was great. I also loved the fruity iced tea. Will defiantly be back!

This place is perfect if you have kids! Why you ask? Well, the entrees don't come with VEGGIES! Man, you don't have to fight the little nuggets they'll hopefully lick the plate clean! Orrrrr, be in my shoes and couldn't fathom finishing the dish. 

The night starts with a consistent lack of acknowledgement from our fabulous server! Or the couple times I got the finger and said she'd be "just a minute." She was so great it took a full 15 minutes before taking our order because I guess serving your family who's finishing up was more important than the hungry hippos. The goat cheese wontons were nothing exciting and the raspberry sauce I felt lacked a lot of the tartness I hope for in a berry! 

For entrees we got the scallops and the short ribs. Well, I guess you do get some Vegetable, if you count your starch potato. The scallops had a minimal dollop under the 4 that were on my plate. The short ribs had a significant amount.. but here's where my dismay comes. EVERY bite was the same, no veggies to offset it, or any flavor for that matter. Every tater bite, every meat bite, was drenched in the sauce. After 5 bites, I'm pretty much over the dish. We had to switch our plates just to help spice up our life. That applies to both meals.

Unfortunately, our star server was clearly uninterested in our table and didn't offer dessert and dropped the check as soon as she cleared off our table. Too bad it was my boyfriends birthday.. I went to the store and baked him Profiteroles instead. Happy Birthday Honey! 

Fail.

Very much a locals place. You will not be blown away by the 80's decor but Todd cooks nightly (take that strip chefs) and lets his food do the talking. 

He keeps the menu fresh and works hard at retaining customers through excellent food and great wait staff.  

The wine dinners are an excellent value.
Amazing food period.  Service was also exceptional, and the waiter really made his recommendations based on our inputs. We will definitely be regulars.
Service was impeccable. The halibut was underwhelming, but the peach cobbler was fantastic!

Have seen reviews but never been-always looking for a great quality bistro that avoids the tourists and the strip area. Dined on Saturday eve and the restaurant was busy but not crowded-noticed several groups of at least 6 people, and with the low ceiling and strip center size, I thought the noise level was high for easy conversation. We noticed that Todds has vegan and vegetarian option designations on the menu, however there were no entrees or salad/appetizer items that were offered that evening. With a vegan diner, we informed the waitress to see what could be worked out. Looked dicey at first as the only option was essentially a vegetable box, but she spoke with Todd and came back with a vegan mushroom risotto option and salad option that worked well and were very well prepared. Spinach salad, Rare Ahi Tuna, a classic martini, and a surprise birthday treat for me were all very good-my only quibble is that the sauce with the Tuna was very salty to my tongue, however I am not a "salter" in general so perhaps others would not find it so. I enjoy highly spiced or flavored, but this was perhaps too heavy on the soy. Portions are moderate, and the prices are fair-I do feel the entrees were expensive for the suburbs and portion size at $27, however the other ala carte items seemed more in line. Service was excellent and d√©cor comfortable. Would love to come back and try some other fish options as well prepared fish is always a treat.

One of my very favorite places to eat out. Have been going to Todd ' s for years. Oysters, skirt steak on fire or the filet & the raspberry dome is my favorite. Can't skip out on a couple of martinis or a glass of wine. 
Keep it up, Todd & I'll keep coming back.

Booked a couple months in advance for Thanksgiving dinner with family. 

The menu was crafted for the holiday and included turkey with all the trimmings as one of four entree options. Everything was flavorful and the presentation was spot on. I had alerted them that I have a food allergy and they were ready when I got there.

Our waiter, Scott, was very attentive without hovering. My mom got the steak instead of turkey and it was delicious, super tender.

The outside of the restaurant is very understated but the atmosphere and the food were outstanding.
We will be back!

Had dinner here last night and everything was great. Had the beet salad, seafood soup, ahi tuna, kobe skirt steak, bread pudding. Service was prompt but not over the top. It's a little out of the way but definitely worth the trip especially if you're one looking to escape the strip (like me!). 

The restaurant was pretty empty for dinner and half of the restaurant was shut down which was pretty sad because it's a really great meal. Get the word out!

Easy drive from the strip, but somehow the taxi driver got lost (neither the driver nor the hotel doorman even heard of the place).  After the meal, had to wait 45 minutes for the taxi called by the maitre d'.   

The service was excellent and friendly.  The chef/owner seemed to know everybody at the bar.  My waitress was super-nice throughout the meal, and when I pointed out an error on the bill of 1$ in my favor (entered incorrectly in the computer) they rewarded me with a glass of Villa M and of course let me keep the dollar.  

The food was good, but unspectacular.  I chose the calamari and rock shrimp with spicy aioli, and the Skirtsteak on fire (marinated in moderately hot sauce).  I didn't finish either dish, a rare occurrence for me.  I did like the wine, particularly the Villa M.

This was our first time here at Todd's. 
The service was excellent!

Food: They serve you some bread while you wait for your food. I had a watermelon martini, it was good. Ordered the crab cakes as an appetizer it was delicious. I had the duck, it was very tender, down side is the fat was not rendered enough so it was chewy. The dish as a whole was just okay, there was too much sweetness on the plate.
The hubby ordered the scallops, he thought the food was delicious. We will be coming back to Todd's!

I had eaten at Todds a few times over the course of the past 10 years and it was always a pleasant experience.  Going there on Valentines Day was totally different. Made reservations, weren't seated on time, but noticed an empty booth obviously waiting for a regular open for 20 minutes. My husband confronted the manager/assuming part owner (female) and she basically shrugged her shoulders and said it's Valentines Day, what do you expect?  I don't know, maybe an apology, free dessert, drink, a smile???   She was so smug. She just didn't care and I get the sense they don't need clientele as they may have a following. I doubt that will last forever.  We left before eating. Good luck with your attitude.  Bye, Todd.

My dad was searching for some fine dining in Henderson and he stumbled across Todd's Unique Dining. We ordered the crab cakes (amazing, no bell peppers in the cakes which is a plus!), dumplings (good, like any other dumplings you'd get anywhere else), tuna tartar on crispy rice (good), scallops with risotto (fantastic, everyone finished theirs), duck breast (very very good) and boneless shortrib (ok).

I have looked at their restaurant week menu offerings a few times over the course of the last few years, but have never gone.  After trying to go to Bertolucci's Brazilian steakhouse (see review). We ended up here on a whim and we were so glad we did!  Their salad offerings are right up my alley!  i had the beet salad which was a little on the small side, but was loaded with beets!  I have had many beet salads in the past that was mostly greens and no beets.  I ended up getting the halibut, upon recommendation of the server because "it is wild caught and fresh and the season was coming to an end". Glad i did, it was very tasty!  Mh husband ordered the short rib and said it was really tender and tasty as well.  Will go return!

It is a 5 indeed. 
I have not found many places like this one. 
What a concept. A real chef who actually does the cooking. 
You can taste the pride. 
Small business with great ambiance and perfect taste and presentation
Worth every penny
Rated by Xtrm

Gotta come here more often!!! Tuna tartare is delicious! Loved the goat cheese wontons. Can't wait for dinner!! Stay for dinner and dessert! We had the meatloaf, short ribs and halibut!  They were amazing!! My pictures didn't turn out. Dessert was the fruit cobbler and salted butterscotch pudding. Amazing!!!! Can't miss this neighborhood gem!

Totally understaffed for Valentine's day.  Hostess disappeared for 10 minutes while multiple couples with reservations just stood around by the door waiting.  What was amusing was that there were at least 6 empty tables around the place at 8pm.

Service suffered immensely, with water not being refilled, long periods of no attention.  

The food as always was excellent.  Just the front of the house let them down.

Had a wonderful "off strip" dining experience at Todd's.  Our friend is a pal of the owner so we were set up with a sampling of many of the apps on the menu - YUM!  They were so well prepared and flavorful - I'd go in just for apps and drinks.  We had dinner though too - which was fanulous.  I had scallops which were phenomenal.  Definitely a place I'd go to regularly if I lived in Vegas and one I hope to go to again on a future trip.

This place is the bomb!! Get the special. Or the short ribs. Or anything. :)  The first time we went, as I suspected, the food was a bit off.  The duck and scallops were both overcooked.  However, the last time we went (gave them another chance), EVERYTHING was AMAZING!  I have to hold back one star for atmosphere, as it's very, very loud if you're not in a booth.  Or perhaps it was just the two parties next to us (we moved).  But, the skirt steak was succulent and cooked perfectly.  Very spicy!  Not for the timid, but I loved it!  My wife's crab and shrimp stuffed Mahi was brilliant!  Our picky guests from the shore dined on the rare Ahi Tuna (rave reviewed) and the braised short ribs, which were my recommendations for them.  They both loved it.  The staff is great here and Todd is THE MAN!  We'll be back!

Tried Todd's on a recent visit to Henderson, and although our hopes were high we were generally underwhelmed.  The decor is extremely dated and unappealing and the booths were surprisingly uncomfortable.  So much so that it actually put a damper on the evening.

Although the appetizers, salad and desserts we tried were nothing to write home about, the entrees were excellent, as previous reviewers have stated.  The signature dish Flank Steak "on fire" was decadent and extremely flavorful (almost too much so), and was truly "unique." The sea bass with artichokes was an excellent dish, although ours was slightly overcooked.  The wait staff was excellent and helpful in righting this error with complimentary desserts.   

Although this is an interesting place it was not good enough to return to, especially at around $30 per entree.

We have never been disappointed dining at Todd's.  The menu doesn't change very often, but they always have specials.  They have exceptional service.  The food is nothing short of amazing.  The special touch to each dish shows.

Had dinner at Todd's during Restaurant Week and had the caesar salad, salmon and butterscotch pudding.  The salad was fresh, crisp and delicious.  The salmon was amazing, nicely seared on the outside and served in a lemon sauce.  The butterscotch pudding with caramel sauce swe-e-e-et and delicious!
I love this place. Fresh seafood and the grumpy salad is to die for  one of my favorite places to eat

My group of 6 decided on Todd's for a Saturday night dinner and we had a fabulous experience.  The restaurant was crowded (likely because they began their Restaurant Week menu) but our table was ready for our 8pm reservation. 

We ordered some cocktails and wine (my girlfriend ordered the raspberry lemon drop martini and it was really yummy) to start.  Todd's has a pretty decent wine menu and the prices are definitely reasonable, so I recommend ordering a bottle instead of cocktails. 

Our server informed us that the chef offers an appetizer sampler for groups of 6 or more, which we decided to order.  Shortly after, each of us received a plate with calamari, one mini crab cake, one goats cheese wonton and one asian dumpling. Everything was delicious!

I ordered the Halibut and my girlfriend ordered the boneless short rib. My Halibut was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing - flaky, soft and served with sweet potato gnocci, which was incredibly delicious.  I literally finished my entire plate of food, which I almost never do.  I tasted the boneless short rib/jalapeno mash and really enjoyed the flavor combinations - not too strong or overpowering at all and perfectly tender short rib.  

Everyone else at the table enjoyed their meals with no complaints. The service was wonderful. Although many people complain about the prices being a little high, i think the prices are actually very reasonable considering the quality of food, diverse flavors and extreme attention to detail in every dish. 

The only thing I didn't like about Todd's was the decor.  The decor doesn't match the restaurants high class food because it looks similar to chain restaurant. Todd's could benefit from a makeover with darker wood and less patterns and better lighting in order to provide the ambiance of a great restaurant.

I had been wanting to come here for so long and finally on my birthday last week we drove across town to have a delicious birthday dinner, or so I had hoped. I can't begin to describe how disappointed I was with the experience and the food. I waited a week before writing a review because I would have annihilated them had I written the review at the time....

It started off with them seating us in the noisy bar area even though my husband had told them it was my birthday when he made the reservations. I thought it inappropriate for them to seat us in the bar when you are celebrating a special occasion. We moved into the dining area and I was ready for an amazing meal. We started with the goat cheese won tons and ahi tuna appetizer. They were both slightly above average but both needed more sauce. We also tried 2 specialty cocktails and neither were very good, and tasted watery. 

Now for the entree, I ordered the Alaskan halibut (btw- what I was served looked nothing like the other reviewer's pic of halibut) thinking it would be absolutely divine, my husband had scallops. What a disappointment!!! My halibut was not fresh caught, tasted like it had just come out of the freezer, AND was overcooked to the point of being completely dry. I had to eat the weird sauce that came with it just to be able to eat the dry chunk of fish. What a waste for the most expensive item on the menu. The scallops were not cooked properly either and were mushy, instead of having a nice crisp on the ends. Both meals came with mashed potatoes that were clearly yesterday's leftovers as they were cold in the center and tasted like a blend of instant and real mashed potatoes. They didn't have flavor and came with an unappetizing gravy that tasted canned. The entire meal was a disappointment but I scarfed down the food just so I could get out of there. Their only saving grace and reason I gave them more than 1 star was that they brought out a birthday dessert for me. 

This is the 2nd year in a row that I had a crappy birthday dinner from trying a new place based on Yelp reviews. I have found many amazing restaurants based on other reviews but I seem to be unlucky on my birthdays. I think next year I will just go somewhere I already know is good.

My boy friend recommended Todd's Unique Dining.  Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  First we were served some bread with butter.  We had the crab cake for our appetizer and it was very tasty.  We shared the house salad.  After reading the Yelp reviews, I had to order the Fire Skirt Steak with fries and it was so delicious.  I enjoyed every bite.  My date ordered the swordfish and I took a big bite of his and it was tasty and moist.  We enjoyed our dinner with some red wine.   I plan to come back because the food is fabulous.

we are getting a little obsessed with this place. everything is so delicious-  but beyond good. like the chef knows exactly how food should be. Seasonal menu to write home about. cocktails are so awesome too. Mark the bartender is a rare true mixologist. Katy the server is a total pro. everything is perfectly flavored. Service is wonderful. Makes an awesome evening. try this place for sure- and you will return.
Another wonderful meal at Todd's. The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel at home. It's nice to find a non corporate restaurant in Henderson that provides a wonderful experience

Very rare nice little restaurant off the strip.  The kind of place common in most cities but stamped out by celebrity chefs.  

This is quality food and when I got the bill it was much less than I know I would've spent anywhere on the strip.   Duck breast, beet salad, bread pudding, cobbler - all excellent.  Surprisingly good cup of coffee with desert also.   Can't recommend it enough - it's a hidden gem in old Green Valley

They refused to serve us because my girlfriend has a seasonal ID, issued by the State of Nevada. But because they had never heard of this local government issued document, with birthdate and all, they embarrassed us and refused to serve us. Horrible service.

Food was great!

Service was great!

Drinks were great!

They even did a little something for our anniversary. I also thought the prices for both drinks and food were fairly decent for the quality of food you were given. 

They get one star knocked off for location.

We have been traveling for 2 weeks and eating at the best places we could find in a variety of locations including Las Vegas and Palm Springs.

This was the best meal we have had on our trip.  In addition, the wine list was outstanding in terms of both selection and price.

This is an A+ place.

My close friend, who lives nearby, and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner reunion at Todd's, December 26. We "discovered" this special restaurant years ago, during my visits from Texas. On this occasion Shayne provided for an excellent evening as he skillfully served carpaccio, scallops, and skirt steak, each one a delight. We had a blast catching up on the Las Vegas Valley as I intend to move there some day, come back really; I lived in Las Vegas 15 years. My daughter lives in Spring Valley. Todd's is a casual, relaxing oasis...perfect for reunions.

Todd's Unique Dining is one of the few places in Henderson that truly deserves all 5 of those stars.  While entrees are about $25-35 they represent a very good value.  On my first trip we enjoyed an tuna tar tar appetiser, scallops and short rib entrees, a house salad and a blue cheese/onion salad with bannannas foster desert.  Everything was superb and it was clear that all of the ingredients were extremely fresh and high quality.  Preparation was first rate, as was presentation.  We dined at 5pm and it was not crowded, but I bet the service would have been just as excellent it the place was full.

It appears that they have a different menu each day of the week.

I look forward to becoming a regular at Todd's Unique Dining!  Highly recommend!

Came here during Las Vegas Restaurant Week 2010 (which runs through Sunday Sept 5th).  This was our second visit to Todd's and enjoyed it as much as the first visit!

Let me say that for $30.10/pp for a 3-course pre-fixe (only this week) - run, don't walk, to take advantage of this steal of a meal!

The bf was afraid that the portion sizes would be small and no way were they.  He had the Grumpy Salad (blue cheese, onion, tomato, iceberg) and loved it!  I had the Caesar and it was great, not too heavy.  Next I had the chicken marsala with these great buttery noodles with course black pepper, which really should be a regular item.  He had the beef (filet) tournados with a green peppercorn sauce with fries and cleaned his plate.  For dessert, they had 3 choices - I shared my sorbet and he cleaned up his chocolate soufle.

Besides a great meal, we shared a wondeful bottle of wine at a very reasonable price!  Great service - great meal.  Restaurant Week is a nice way to visit your current favorite or next favorite restaurant all while a proceed is donated to a nice charity.

http://www.threesquare.org/events/event-calendar/restaurant-week/
Amazing and truly unique food. Great service. A little pricier than the places I usually eat but I'll be back for sure, just not every week. :-)

Service was great. Ambiance is casual but nice. The place is a bit dated. 

Food:
Started off with the cream cheese wonton appetizer which is totally overrated. Do not recommend 

Duck breast entree is delicious. The duck was amazing. I thought the mashed yams were too sweet for my taste though. I would've preferred mashed potatoes. 

Skirt steak marinated in jalape√±os was amazing. The meat was really tender. Comes with fries which I thought was just okay

Our first time here.  Like the names states very unique and impressive dinner experience. Truly an amazing selection of meals to choose from. I had the Prime steak which was so good. Don't forget the starters like Tuna Tartare and a Grumpy Salad. I will most definitely be going back for more.

As you walk in the smell is delicious. The appetizers and main dishes were tasty and correctly proportioned for a pleasant experience that didn't overwhelm.

It was very unfortunate that our dessert (a mousse with a sponge base) had picked up some mold (yes - blue mold on the base). We alerted the kitchen to this fact only to be told that it was not mold but chocolate powder and flour. I don't know why they felt the need to deny the extremely characteristic smell/taste/color - perhaps they were afraid of a health inspection. At least they comp'ed the dessert.

We left insulted and disappointed for that single unfortunate event.

They weren't kidding when they call themselves "unique dining." You get everything from steaks. seafood, to asian dumplings.

Boyfriend wanted to take me here for a casual dinner date. Once I entered this quaint little restaurant, I know right off the bat how much I will enjoy the ambiance. For a second there, I thought I was somewhere in Chicago or New York. You got the dim lighting with Frank Sinatra-esque soundtrack lightly playing throughout the night.

Apparently, the menu is always changing because our menu was dated on the day we went. (March 30, 2015.) Not sure how often they're changing the menu.

Too bad I wasn't too hungry that day, otherwise I would've gotten their skirt steak with chili cheese fries. Random, right!? Who the heck pairs a steak with something so normal as french fries? But hey! It worked! My boyfriend ordered that and gave me a few pieces to try and omgosh! That sauce.....geez! It smelled great and tasted even better. Full of flavor! The chili cheese fries was good too....fresh melted cheese, chili, and they had some kind of black bean sauce that had a smoked flavor to it.
I ordered Asian dumplings and a side of chili cheese fries as my entree. 

The bill wasn't too bad either. A soda, two glass of wines and our entrees cost about $85. 

We will definitely be back again!
Fantastic servers, amazing wine dinners, sign up for their mailing list and keep updated with what is new and fresh. http://www.toddsunique.com/

My husband and I dined there on Valentines day. First time there and very disappointing. I ordered the sea bass, they were out of it, understandable for a holiday. So I opted for the NY steak with tiger prawn for $38. We had crab cake app, average. I ordered the lobster bisque, had no lobster in it. my husband had cesear salad,it was ok. it took a long time for the courses to come out, still understandable for a holiday. He ordered the scallops, it was good. My steak was the worst steak I've ever had. It was a fatty piece of cheap meat, with little tiny chopped up pieces of shrimp on top. If I had scooped the pieces together it would be a half dollar size. I asked the waitress doesn't this include tiger prawn? She responded its chopped up in the sauce. I thought it was a spice, didn't taste like shrimp. It was like they ran out of shrimp and used one las remaining shrimp for 3 steaks, very disappointing. Needless to say, I will never be back! $120 for a very subpar restaurant! The service was good, but the cooks need lessons on how to cook!

We enjoyed another amazing dinner at Todd's last night July 7.  We had family in from NYC who enjoyed this off the Strip gem of a restaurant.  

Chef Clore thank you for always making us feel welcomed.    The staff and service are perfect.  The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.  What a treat every time we visit Todd's.

the food we had was excellent, well seasoned and delicious. however i asked for a side of string beans intead of potatoes and they charged me $3 and gave me about 10 beans. The selection is very limited as well. Maybe if the specials were good we would go back.

I love that Todd's is a true local gem. The quality and presentation of the food is 5-star, top notch. This is a high end restaurant at off the strip mid-range prices. Dont be fooled by the look. The service is excellent and food something really unique to find off the strip in Vegas. 

I'm an especial admirer of their cobbler desserts. I've tried the rhubarb, the strawberry, and most recently this apple-mixture cobbler. Amazing desert. I really go there mostly for this. The short rib is also excellent. I like the beet salad as well. 

I think my only real suggestion is that they just add more specials or mix up the menu a bit more. I've been there maybe 10 times and I know I'd go more often with a few more specials, something different than what they serve already or a new menu item or appetizer. Maybe a nice risotto or something like that. Would love to see more creations from the great chef.

Picked this place for dinner based on reviews . From the first encounter the service was outstanding . We ordered the calamari , Cesar salad scallops and meatloaf based on reviews and " signature" dishes on the menu. Calamari was over cooked - salad was great and the scallops were outstanding . Meatloaf was bland and overcooled and the veggies were undercooked with minimal gravy - at $23 we expected more . Our waitress was outstanding with some of the best service we have had - attentive , engaging and knowledgeable so the service was 5 and the food was 3.

Nice little restaurant, tucked away on Sunset Rd. We were introduced to this little gem by friends who invited us to join them for the Christmas Eve menu. The food is great and the staff friendly. It appears to cater to a loyal local crowd and they even have a small bar in the corner with great choices of wine & beers.
They also host special wine tasting dinner menus on occasion, as well as special holiday menus.
The place is very small, so I definitely recommend reservations. On our particular night, they actually asked us to bump up our reservations, then were running behind, then forgot we were waiting and gave away our table. Granted, it was a holiday and very busy but there's nowhere to wait unless you stand outside with the smokers or just inside the door where people are eating. This was the only hiccup and the rest of the night was great. I do recommend giving them a try and I look forward to returning when they're not so busy.

My experience at Todd's Unique Dining was indeed unique. When we walked in the restaurant was empty. The hostess asked if we had a reservation when we replied no she acted as though she wouldn't be able to seat us. However, she managed to find a table (out of the 10 open tables) for us to sit. The waitstaff were very friendly, however like other posts read, cater to the regulars way more. It was very obvious yet I didn't feel neglected. We sat near the kitchen and I understand the stress of the culinary industry, however, in a restaurant of this caliber I should not be able to hear people yell and swearing at each other from my table. The upside to my entire experience is that the food was phenomenal. The portions were perfect satisfying my appetite. This is a pricy place, however, I would suggest everyone to try it. Sadly, I will probably not return due to the unprofessionalism and favoritism to regulars.
This was our second time at the place. I have zero complaints. The portions were perfect, and the flavor was spot on! We will become regulars, I'm sure. You have to try the duck, it was great

Second time here for my boyfriend and I and as always the food was amazing! !the service was incredible too ....is our new favorite place. If you want to taste great food in  the henderson area this is the place to go you would not be disappointed
I love Todd's! The service is friendly & the food is outstanding. When we were not thrilled with the soup they took it off the bill without us asking.

I must have gone on an off day, I guess. I picked the scallops, as they were a "Signature Dish" - one would think that would be one of the best things on the menu, no? Well, what I got was a four undercooked, flavorless, unpleasant globs of sea-life, served in what, had I not read the menu to make sure that's not what it was, a pool of cat vomit. The mashed potatoes with the mushrooms in them were good, at least. The rest of it - I'm definitely more on the "leave it" side. 

As far as I'm concerned, it's called "Unique Dining" because you'll only eat there once.

Ambiance probably the worsr of all time haha but that makes it fun because u will be suprised when main course arrives! Service is ok. Could be much better however owners are very close minded and arrogant about how to run a restaurant. 
Food is good The Appetizers are rather boring except the Goat Cheese wontons with raspberry sauce VERY GOOD. Salads are ok The Watermelon salad is most impressive. Main Courses however are exceptional no doubt. Skirt Steak on Fire is AMAZING. All main course items are very very good. Definitely worth checking this place out.  Deseerts again nothing to rave about. Price is a little steep when go for the whole deal , meaning apps , salads, main, desserts. U can skip a lot of that maybe share a salad and come for the main courses which are truly kick ass and unique..

I really like the purpose and local community focus of this restaurant and its neighborhood fine dining focus.  I also really like that they are community contributors, providing services for local non-profits and their customers.

I have been to Todd's several times (about 1 month ago was my most recent visit.)

I found the food in general to be well prepared, with generous servings.  However, I found the food to also be mildly seasoned, which did not provide the depth of flavor I hope for when dining in a finer restaurant.  

For example, the short rib entree I had was a very large portion, and very well cooked and tender.  However, it had a somewhat bland flavor in my opinion.  This had also been my experience in the past with an ahi entree.  The caesar salad I had was also relatively mild and unremarkable - I typically like a caesar salad at a better restaurant with whole or large fresh piece of romaine, a good portion of anchovy, and fresh large croutons, with the salad well dressed.  This salad was little cut-up pieces of romaine, and just was not prepared in any remarkable way - seemed like a prepared in advance and chilled item that was bland and uninteresting.

The only outlier in my meals has been the 'Steak On-Fire' entree, which was cooked well, and had a well seasoned and spicy sauce.  I could have lived without the chili cheese fries on the side - messy, overproportioned, and texture was kind of soft/undistinguished based on a variety of ingredients with a similar texture.

Booths are also pretty uncomfortable - these need to be upgraded (too vertical, not enough cushion - just not a very natural seating position for dining).

Again - I think Todd's is an important restaurant in this neighborhood, especially in that shopping area which is currently seeing difficult times - I just think they need to season their food better and be a little more consistent in the design, preparation and elements of this food.  I would really like to ultimately see this as a 4-5 star review.

I can't believe it took me so many years to try Todd's.  I missed out!  Though the hubby and I are making up for lost time by patronizing Todd's on a frequent basis.

Let's talk about the food.  

The appetizers and salads.  The hubby has tried the ahi tuna tartar, Dungeness crab cake, and Grumpy's salad.  He's mentioned their good but not exactly what he was expecting.  I always order their caesar salad to start out.  It is delicious!  It's not the typical caesar because the dressing is a white balsamic/caesar dressing--it gives it a great flavor!  

For entrees, I'll preface that I was NOT a short rib fan, until I tried Todd's.  Just go to their website toddsunique.com and watch the video for the short ribs, and you'll want to try them too.  The meat is so moist and falls apart upon it's first touch with the fork.  The gravy is succulent, with bits of carrot and onion.  Underneath it all, there's the jalapeno mashed potatoes (I get them w/out jalapenos) which carry a nice zest to the plate.  I've also tried their filet mignon, magnificent!  It is served with a complimenting cabernet/blue cheese sauce and a few grilled veggies.  As I mentioned before I do not eat things that have crawled/perched/swam around in the water, so I'll relay what the hubby said about the seared scallops.  "They were perfectly cooked," "some of the best scallops I've ever had."  The hubby has also had their shrimp risotto, and said it was very good and rich.  Overall, I might classify Todd's style of food as "American Fusion Comfort Food."

Desserts are pretty darn good here too, so leave room!  I'll let you explore the dessert menu on your own!

Todd's is a very casual, comfortable, homely, semi-fine dining restaurant.  There is a full bar on the right side of the restaurant, and from what I understand they do run food and drink specials at the bar.  I've noticed most of the clientele seems to be more on the mature side (40s+).  That being said, most of the clientele are repeat customers, therefore I do recommend reservations.  Todd's is nestled in a strip mall on the corner of Sunset & Athenian.

Just recently, I've seen the headline, "if you have bad customer service, it's probably because you are a back customer." (Or something similar to that) Tonight's experience echoed this quote. We were excited to be out, we were excited to try this restaurant and we were excited for the dishes we ordered. Our server, Anthony, mirrored our excitement! This was great and even though a previous table got allllllll in a tizzy about their food being 'delayed because they ordered a salad', he approached our table with a fresh take. {side note: if you continue to pick at and hold your salads, the server will hold your entrees. This is dining 101 so don't blame the salads or the service, blame your common sense}. My scallops were perfectly coolly with a slightly salty cauliflower bed. My husbands short rib did the "fall apart just enough" thing it's supposed to do so he was happy as can be. 

The food was great but the experience made it over the top. Being from Philadelphia, I like service that is proper but still approachable and family based... like your server will give you proper wine service then sit down and shoot the shit with you. And that's what we got. 

See you soon, Todds.

Great entrees. Creme brulee was overcooked so they took it off our bill. Dinner took 2 hours..it took a long time for them just to take our order. Wine list is not that great. The short rib was melt in your mouth good and the fries with the skirt steak on fire were awesome!

Been here a few times that I can't believe I have forgotten to write a review.

This is one of those un-assuming places yet amazing restaurants in Henderson that it seems hardly anyone knows about.  Unless you are someone who likes to go out to eat a lot like me.  :)

I'd call this dressy, casual.  Not T-shirts casual but in the summer time you can definitely wear nice Bermuda shorts and a button down shirt or sundress or in the winter you can wear a nice pair of jeans and sweater.  Anyways...

The Ambiance - - 
Casual, Simple but Elegant

The Service - - 
Professional, Genuine, Friendly

The Food - - 
Changes periodically. Everything I've ever had has been perfectly prepared and presented.
Recently I enjoyed the Rabbit with Cassoulet.  The perfect comfort food!

The Wine - - 
They have a great wine list.... lots to choose from and the pricing is not stupid expensive like on the strip.  Very reasonably priced.

The Dessert - - 
Save Room!
You have to order one of their desserts.
Recently we had the bread pudding and it was rich and buttery and melt-in-your-mouth good.

For Henderson....it's a great restaurant...for Las Vegas, it's "okay".

As for decor and ambiance, I'm not a fan.  The booths have 1980's upholstery and the general layout is a little too boring for me. But I'm reviewing the food, not the decor.

Started with the Goat Cheese Wontons....absolutely incredible dish, I wanted to order 3 more orders!

Moved then to a Watermelon Salad, drizzled in lime sauch and cheese crumples...very nice and light, perfect amount before diving into the main course.

Short Ribs....very nicely done with great sauce.  Meat fell apart at the touch of the fork.

Also had the scallops, to which I was actually NOT a fan of...a little too simple and plain...didn't spark my tastebuds as much as the other items ordered.

Service was genuine, but a little backed up due to the dinner rush.  Having 2 servers cover 16 tables is very difficult, but they managed it well.

All in all, I will certainly return and try some more dishes.

This was our first time to Todd's and we will definitely be back.  We love places off the beaten path that have amazing food and worth the drive, thus came finding Todd's.

I stumbled across it using Open Table (I won't go to any restaurant in Vegas with out reservations).  The menu looked amazing, my kind of food, and seemed worth the 8 mile drive from the strip.  

The restaurant is located in Henderson/Green Valley, and very unassuming.  It would not have been a place I would have even considered had it not been for open table and Yelp reviews.  You may miss it as you drive by.   The decor was ok, very homey feeling, room for about 80 or so diners, with a very nice full bar with seating for another 8 or so.

We were sat immediately in a booth (most of the restaurant is booths, a couple tables, the one adjacent to us was reserved for a large party).  Our waiter greeted us and gave us a great introduction to the menu.  The menu is printed daily with several daily specials, seasonal specials, and a few regular items that are Todd's Signature items.  We thought we would do a mix of a few of each.

Bread arrived, and it was fantastic. A great focaccia and sweet cranberry bread that was wonderful. 

We ordered 2 appetizers.  Their signature Goat Cheese won tons were amazing.  They were the right combination of goat cheese and cream cheese and spices. They were perfectly fried and sitting on a raspberry gastrique swirled with creme fraiche, topped with 3 kinds of sesame seeds and a small amount of fresh basil. OMG YUM!  I also got a glass of Prosecco to go with my appetizers and this matched very well with these.

Our second app was Lobster stuffed mushrooms. Brown mushroom caps that were perfectly cooked and stuffed with lobster. They were served in a small skillet with a small gravy/butter sauce.  There were 8-10 mushrooms which were plenty, we were actually surprised how many we got.

Our second course we did a soup and salad.  I got the Grumpys salad which was like an iceberg wedge that was chopped for you.  The dressing was awesome, the perfect amount of blue cheese, delicious grape tomatoes, and a sprinkle of fresh chives. I didn't know you could make a wedge salad so amazing.  My husband got the special soup of the night which was a mushroom soup with creme fraiche on top.  It tasted like blended fresh mushrooms.  It was definitely not a heavy cream of mushroom soup, but actually nice and light and was fantastic. 

For entrees, I got the Signature Short rib. WOW... I won on this one. It was a baseball sized cut of short rib that was perfectly cooked.  It was almost like a pot roast. Super flavorful, tender and moist.  It was sitting on mashed potatoes that were superb all surrounded by a sauce/gravy that was out of this world.  You could taste the love in this dish. 

My husband got the special of the night which was a seafood risotto. It was just ok.  Honestly, and this is weird to say, there was too much seafood in it, we would have like to have had more of the risotto.  The seafood was good, scallops, mexican sea bass, lobster, and crab, but it was almost overwhelming.  There were also a couple small pieces of shell in the risotto. The flavor was good but it was just not to the level that the short rib was.

For dessert we got the creme brulee which was fantastic.  A very creamy vanilla custard with a perfect sugar crust on top.  Everything that I love about a great creme brulee.

When I went to the bathroom, you can see into the kitchen and you can actually see Todd back there cooking.  I commented to the waiter that this was something that I love.  Many of the celebrity chefs on the Strip just have their name on the entrance and may have helped design the menu but thats about it.  Todd is cooking back there which is something I really appreciate.  As I said before, you can taste the love in his food. 

The food was also reasonably priced, we would have paid at least 50% more for this food at a Strip restaurant in a major hotel.  I also liked that the restaurant was packed on a Wednesday night, packed with locals, and filled with many repeat customers. 

I will definitely make a return trip to Todd's on our next Vegas trip.  I think I would have like to have ordered 1 or two more appetizers and just split the entree.  I like more Tapas style dining and the selection of appetizers and salads would make this perfect at Todd's.  I knocked the star off their rating for two reasons: 1 - the shells in my husbands seafood risotto and 2- the booth was a little tight/uncomfortable, I think it may have actually been that booth, it seemed a touch smaller than the rest. 

Our waiter said that Todd will usually come out to talk to the patrons, especially first time diners, but he was pretty busy in the kitchen (like I said, restaurant was packed).  He also gave us a tip that on Wednesdays there is no corkage fee for up to two bottles.

We have been on a dining quest - we live in Las Vegas and hate to go to the strip - overpriced, touristy, and too too crowded.  In our quest, we tried Todd's, which is very close to our home and which we had, embarrassingly, managed overlook for a long time.

This is what I would call the quintessential romantic restaurant - small and intimate, perfect food, out of the way and kind of a local secret.  I could see "popping the question" here - it is the kind of place that you would be calling "our" place even if you hadn't experienced a proposal there.

My husband had the steak, I had fish, friends made other choices - all were perfect, great portions, great staff, everything the way you picture in your mind that a great little place should be.  Todd used to be a chef at some other major restaurant and now has this little place where he can food-riff all he wants.  Think of the mental picture you get from that sentence, then go - you will get exactly what you anticipated - personal service, great food, nice atmosphere.  Local favorite.  MAKE RESERVATIONS!

I love food. I try to find something different, something that at the end of the dinner I could honestly say that it was an "experience" rather than a "meal"--and Todd's did just that.  For months I would skim over his website, wondering if it would be worth the journey from North Las Vegas to East Sunset in Henderson, and last night we decided to give it a try.  We made reservations through opentable, where I've accumulated 10,000 points so far, and arrived on time at 7:45pm.  The server was friendly, attentive, and although it's in a strange place for what I consider high scale service, it was welcomed.  They have a notable wine list, a quaint bar and an interesting drink menu, which we did not partake in that evening.  Concentrating on dissecting textures, tastes and ingredients that night, I can honestly say that I was impressed.  His ravioli's, although hesitant at first to order southwest-themed ones, were very good.  Perfectly creamy on the inside, not overpowering sauce on the outside, and the southwest theme played well for something that is of Italian origin.  I very much enjoyed the tomato salad, which was plated beautifully and paired very nicely with a creamy balsamic.  The highlight of the evening were the two dishes of scallops and lamb--sauces to die for, perfectly cooked and very well presented.  Dessert, which was peach and ginger cobbler a la mode, paired with complimentary sparkling wine was the perfect ending to a perfect dinner.  

If you are the type of person looking for extremely fancy, 5 michelin star food at this place, to be honest, it's not that.  It's more of a true dining experience in taste and textures both.  It's a place where the sauces blow your tastebuds away, where in some miracle mexican pasta isn't a bad thing at all, and where the dining at the end can be summed up as a true experience.  The chef knows how to pair flavors and textures well, and present seasonal food with grace and style.  

I gave it a 5/5 stars because it truly deserves it. Knowledgeable staff, great variety, and out of this world flavors. 

A new hit for me--now it's your turn.

I have driven by this place for two years. Got this recommended by a friend and glad I finally tried it. Great happy hour at the bar, the dates and won tons were amazing. Then the short rib for a main course was equally as great. No doubt we will become regulars here. Ask for Caleb at the bar.

Worth every penny and it's not over priced like the strip restaurants. If you are visiting  LV, step away from the slot machine and see how well the locals eat!  This place doesn't look like much from the outside but the food is top notch and service is spot on!  Enjoy Todd's before the secret gets out and you can't get a table.

After listening to friends rave and after reading many 5 star reviews of Todd's Unique Dining we (5 of us) decided it was time we added this place to our monthly dining choices.  We were not disappointed. 

The food and service are excellent.  Todd bowed to my request to add a couple of his much touted scallops to my pan seared Lake Superior Whitefish.   The scallops deserve all the praise they get, but the star here was the Whitefish flown in fresh from Michigan.   The top was seared to form a crunchy crust that complimented the moist, perfectly done interior.  Thank you Todd.  Three of us ordered the Whitefish and no one left a crumb.  As a former Michigan resident I miss the LS Whitefish.  

One of our party ordered a full order of scallops and said they were the best she'd ever had.  Cindy ordered the  melt-in-your-mouth-like-butter Short Ribs.  A large portion, covered in an untensly flavored and delicious gravy. 

Salads all around except for me, were excellent and fresh.  I chose the Asian Dumplings (potstickers) with dipping sauce.  The dumpligs were small, very tender and sooo very deicious as was the dipping sauce.  Not a complaint from anyone at our table.   Oh and the awesome Watermelon/Jalapeno Martini was over the top.  
Bananas Foster for dessert - excellent.   

The ambiance is very nice, somewhatt romantic if that's what you're looking for and reservations are strongly recommeded.  

Our waitress was quiet, efficient and very polite.  Special thanks to the busser - whose name I didn't get - for taking the photos of our group.

Incredible fun find in vegas!!! Don't miss the skirt steak "on fire". Everything we had was memorable and delicious. Very creative, fun menu. We will be adding it to our "don't miss" list every time we are in Vegas.

I came here with some friends for Restaurant Week.  I actually planned to order the braised short ribs or duck breast a la carte but was pleased to find they had a 40 dollar RW menu in addition to their 30 dollar menu.  I was excited to try their signature braised short ribs dish so it was a no brainier ordering it.  Things went down quickly after.

The beef carpaccio appetizer was decent.  I wasn't wow'ed but everything was fresh. It just lacked the extra element to take it to the top.  Next came their signature braised short ribs and this was disappointing.  The portions were huge and the jalape√±o mashed potatoes were good but the short ribs weren't seasoned at all.  It was slightly over cooked and I had to douse it with salt - a good 2-3 salt applications.  I'm not one to usually season my food especially at a fine dining spot where execution on a signature dish should be like a layup.  The highlight of the meal was the chocolate cake definitely.

For the money there's far too many other options to spend your money.  This is more of a 2 but rounded up to 3 bc of service and the Weds no wine corkage fee bumps up but i won't be coming back

We thoroughly enjoyed our meals.  The menu is short, but each the meals chosen, they were all excellent - clearly they focus on doing really well with few rather than doing okay with lots.  We took a cab from the Strip and paid (there and back) $80 in travel costs.  Ignoring this financial blunder, the restaurant is worthy of praise and was a much needed escape from the "in your face" experience on the Strip.  The ambiance in Todd's is charming but dated...certainly no Club Chasse et Peche (√† Montreal).  In summary: if you have your own car, check this place out.

Todd's really is a hidden gem in Henderson. This should be an option for anyone looking for a romantic dinner or somewhere to bring out-of-towners wanting to avoid the Strip. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel like you're part of their family. Though no one was at the bar while we were there on a Friday for dinner, I can't wait to come back for Happy Hour. 

To start we shared the goat cheese won tons and the grumpy salad. The won tons are served atop a sweet raspberry basil sauce which paired perfectly with the tart goat cheese. The grumpy salad had shredded lettuce and a wee bit too much dressing, so I'm glad we shared this and didn't have to eat it all myself. 

For dinner I had the seared sea scallops with risotto. Yes there are four of them but they are HUGE. Unbelievably plump and buttery. The risotto had mushrooms in it and was a nice palate cleanser but I'm not a big fan of the texture of risotto. Everyone including myself loved the short ribs. Most of the photos I've seen of this dish aren't very appetizing but believe me it's really good. 

Todd's can be a bit expensive so I don't go except for special occasions but the food is definitely high quality and the experience is always pleasant.

My first time here and it far exceeded my hopes. It was terrific. The Asian dumplings and goat cheese wonton starters were delicious. The duck breast perfectly cooked, juicy meat, crisp skin. The ahi tuna with Wasabi mashed beyond incredible. And all this at very reasonable prices. You will totally love this hidden Vegas gem.

We went with our family for Christmas Eve and wow. The restaurant itself is small and quaint, which I love. 
 The food was incredible, you can tell the chef puts so much effort into each dish. 
I mean it was truly just incredible. Will definitely be going back!! 

The staff was so pleasant and kind, even with the rush of people coming in , our drinks were always refilled before we could even ask. 

Great food, great service, a must try!

I was so excited to try this place being a pescatarian and looking for good places to eat off the strip.  But I was very disappointed. 
We started out with the crab cake with remoulade, the crab cakes were nothing special and the remoulade tasted nothing like any remoulade I've ever tasted in New Orleans.  Next we got the Watermelon salad, which was actually a fun surprise, spicy and sweet, by the end I had lost some of taste from the cayenne, it would have been better as dessert.  For the main attraction my man go the skirt steak, he thought it was ruined with all the sauce, there was just too much on it, taking away for the flavor of the meat.  I got a pan-seared fish, but it was deep fried and I hated it.  Why would a place the boasts about the fresh quality of their food disguise it with oil and sub-par sauce.  And to top it off our waiter interrupted us every 5 min, don't get me wrong I love good service but this dude was just rude!
Wow! My first time dining here and it was delicious! Great food and excellent service! Terri was our waitress and she was absolute perfection!!

I love an excellent dining experience and I have to say, I'm impressed.  First, let me compliment the staff here.  From the bus people to the bartender, kudos.  Everyone was attentive, pleasant and professional.  This is a great staff focused on excellent service.  Second, the food was amazing.  Started with the goat cheese wontons, delicious.  Moved to the grain salad, fresh and satisfying.  Finished with their signature skirt steak on fire and the monkfish.  Every dish was well prepared with a lovely presentation.  I loved the unique pairings of sauce and dish.  I highly recommend checking out this hidden gem.

Came for New Years Eve and hadn't been here in quite awhile but was very very happy with the experience!
It was busy so although our reservations were at 7:15 weren't seated til after 8, couple at our table DID NOT want to leave!
Service, however, was amazing!  Food was delicious, 3 of us ordered the lamb which was perfectly cooked and so tasty!  
We brought our own wines and they were perfectly attended to...bread was delicious and desserts were great as well.
It was a wonderful evening, festive and busy but the servers were on top of everything and all is a good mood which made the evening a success!

Recommended by my sister who lives in Henderson as a good place for me and my wife's anniversary dinner. Made reservations online and was promptly seated upon our arrival. Small intimate place with a great staff. Hard to make a decision since the menu items all looked great! I had the meatloaf and my wife had the skirt steak. Both were absolutely amazing! Dessert was fantastic as well. Wonderful choice for our special day and I recommend! Thank you, we enjoyed our dining experience.

I first dined at Todd's a week ago and I've been back twice since!  It might be a bit soon to make this call, but I am going to go out on a limb and declare it to be my overall favorite off-strip restaurant in Vegas.  Blows away Rosemary's.

Todd serves creative, well executed, high-quality food made with fresh seasonal ingredients combining both subtle and bold flavors,  I suppose some might say there is Asian influence, but I consider it to be West Coast American Nouveau.  I must admit, however, that this review might be slightly biased because it is soft shell crab season and I am sort of a soft shell crab whore.  

Besides the juicy, succulent, makes-my-mouth-water-just-thinking-about-it soft shell crab, everything I've had there has been surprisingly good.  On a couple occasions I've even caught myself chuckling out loud about an unexpected twist or an extra added touch which took the dish to the next level.  

One example would be the time I ordered what the menu that day called surf and turf - day boat scallops and tournedos of beef .  I ordered scallops rare and they were prepared exactly how I like them.  The tenderloin was well cooked, properly seasoned and balanced out with the scallops nicely.  However what took the dish to the next level in my opinion was the attention to detail found in the veg served on the plate.  Squash, beautiful broccoli, perfectly cooked enoki mushrooms, fresh green beans, and to top it off (and what made me chuckle) was a 2 inch piece of delicious, sweet corn still on the cob.  Nice touch.

I won't go into detail about their must-order signature Kobe short rib, but  I will tell you they braise it for three days to create unparalleled tenderness.

The service at Todd's is top notch.  Besides being attentive and well versed on the menu and the cooking techniques used, the servers are very nice and not afraid to engage in some friendly conversation.  In my opinion one of the keys to good service is making the customers feel comfortable and they certainly achieve that here.

With the kind of food and service one might expect from a white tablecloth restaurant, it is refreshing to be served in a more cozy, relaxed environment.  There is a no-smoking bar on one side of the restaurant that has a bit of an old-fashioned feel to it but then they've got the basketball playoffs going on the TV. 

Todd is an actual person (chef/owner) and from what I can tell he is there most nights and makes an effort to come out on the floor and interact with the guests, another nice touch.  

I'm glad to have discovered this gem and it's already become a new weekly spot for me in spite of being clear across town from me.

In support of restaurant Week, Todd's has again created a great menu. There were choices between 2 dinner options. Both are 3 courses. My choice was:

First Course: Goat Cheese Wonton with Raspberry Basil Sauce. The dish consisted of 5 wontons filled with warm goat cheese. Just spread on the raspberry sauce to create a heavenly starter. 

Second Course: Branzino with Shrimp Risotto and asparagus. The fish was cooked perfectly and the risotto was smooth as silk.

Third Course: Salted Caramel Butterscotch Pudding. Lost for words. Just a perfect finish.

As in the past, service was on point, with the wait staff friendly and attentive. Glad they still have The Puzzle - 2006 Pinot Noir but I was told they are almost out.

Again Thank You Todd's for providing an opportunity to support Three Square.

We finally tried Todd's and am very happy we did. It's nice to find a great place to eat off the strip and we will return. We were first seated in a booth. The booths have vertical backs and aren't very comfortable. We asked for a table and were reseated right away. Service from start to finish was friendly and attentive. Couldn't have been happier. They have a few half bottles of wine on the list and the Armand Riesling was delicious. The bread basket was good although butter very hard. Apps were a perfect carpaccio and a very good but bit loose crab cake. Entrees were Sea Scallops and Duck Breast, both cooked perfectly. The scallops tasted perfectly fresh and had just the right sear. The duck breast also had a nice crust on one side and was one of the best in a long time. We both had bananas foster and an ice wine for desert, both very good. The decor inside leaves a bit to be desired - its a plain place but the delicious food and excellent service are enough that we will be back soon. It was a great dinner.

I can't believe it took me 10 years to dine at Todd's again for the second time. My loss. Everything was amazing.  A party of 4 of us went last night. We all enjoyed the experience. The braised short ribs were very flavorful and I didn't need a knife to cut the meat. Crab cake and grumpy salad were delicious.  I like the location because you are away from the strip and you can park close to the building. I will not wait so long next time to visit Todd's.

I felt this restaurant was very overpriced for what you got.  The restaurant itself is very old and not in a classic way.  Furniture was cheap and tables pushed very close to one another.  The food was just alright, but not worth the price.  I won't be coming back here again which is too bad, because I live right down the street.

This place was mediocre at best.  Service was good from host stand to our server.


Unless you're 120 lbs or less and lisle to sit up at a 90 degree angle, this place has the most cramped undersized booths. I was squirming to get out of the booth my entire meal.

For appetizers, the watermelon salad and goat cheese won tons were both delicious.

Entrees left a lot to be desired. The eggplant pasta was missing a key ingredient...  EGGPLANT! It's like the took the eggplant out and added extra balsamic!

We enjoyed the scallops and short ribs but the mashed potatoes tasted like they just came out of the microwave.

A bit of a disappointment but needed to try this much talked about place.
Love Todd's... There's always something amazing on the menu.  No pretense... just great food.

Attended the monthly wine dinner at Todd's Unique Dining, this month they featured wines from Middleton Family Wines.  Started the dinner with a wonderful 2012 Adobe White Blend-- 36% Viognier, 34% Grenache Blanc, 24% Sauvignon Blanc, 6% Princes--had a bright straw color with aromas of orange blossoms, mandarin zest, jasmine, sweet fennel and honey, with hints of fresh-ground nutmeg, a little tropical fruit flavors of mango, cherimoya, and white peach predominate with a firm acidity level and a great balanced mouth-feel. The course served was a fabulous King Crab Cake--delicate with a light crisp breading--accompanied with a delicious Bok choy slaw, had a tantalizing sesame seed oil and rice wine vinegar dressing.  The next course was Alaskan Halibut filet, served with a truffle cream sauce--sweet cream with a slight nuttiness and earthiness flavor, this was plated with herbed barley which enhanced the earthiness of the course.  This course was pared with 2013 Inconceivable White Queen of Tides--a 100% Chardonnay with a bright straw color with aromas of tropical fruit, honey, marzipan, wet stone and some yeasty undertones. The wine has flavors of pineapple, with a distinctive sea-floor minerality, and bright acidity in the mouth. The surprise is the viscosity and smooth mouthfeel that brings you to a warm, spicy, oak-tinged finish that lingers. The next wine presented was 2012 Adobe Red Blend--23% Zinfandel, 22% Petite Sirah, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Malbec, 10% Petit Verdot, 4% Tempranillo, and 3% Syrah.  This wine had a dark black cherry and dusty mocha aromas with soft, jammy strawberry and black fruit characters combine in the mouth for a complex blend of fruit flavors. The tannins were soft and rounded, leaving a rich mouthfeel, finishing with a lacing of warm toasty vanilla a very good selection.  The Butternut Squash Ravioli--homemade, airy with a very sweet butternut filling--with a brown butter and fried sage leaf dusted with Parmesan cheese pared well.  The main course was a Bone-in Short rib, very tender and flavorful with a red wine essence accompanied with a mushroom potpie--a combination of cremini mushrooms with a biscuit and cheddar cheese topping. Also served with buttered orzo to complete the course.  This course was pared with 2012 Inconceivable Cabernet Sauvignon a very nice wine.  Intense deep purple hue, dark fruits (black berry, black cherry) and toasted bread lead the aromatics. Savory aspects of dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, and a slight tinge of wet earth add complexity. On the palate, the wine is medium to full-bodied, with fruit character echoing the aromatics, plus subtler elements of cocoa powder, tanned leather, red and Bing cherries, the finish lingers for an extended length of time with a persistent character of dried berries. The dessert course was a Chocolate Devil's food cake with butter frosting a splash of blackberry coulis and chocolate ice cream with chips.  This was pared with a 2013 Clayhouse Cabernet Sauvignon, deep purple/dark red color. Aromas of dark Bing cherry, black currant, and hints of cedar and sweet vanilla. The wine is rich, full bodied and has sweet black cherry and ripe plum fruit flavors with licorice undertones. This Cabernet has chewy but rounded and smooth tannins and finishes with warm toasty notes.  The evening was enjoyable and well attended, I enjoyed most of the wines and food courses definitely presented well and thank you to Chef Todd for his creations.

From the minute I stepped into this place for Valentines it was a disaster. We had a 8:30 reservation and walked in at 8:20 and didn't get seated till 9pm which is whatever. Our bread didnt come out until 20 minutes after we sat down only because I had to ask him for it. The waiter came over after 13 minutes after we were seated to take our drink order and I said do you have stolich elite on the rocks and he told me yes.. 7 minutes later he brought my girls drink and told me oh we are out and then the host came over and said yea we stopped buying that 3 months ago, i dont even care about the drinks. Now another 12 minutes later the waiter finally comes back and takes our order so we are there over 30 minutes without even getting our order in. We were going to order from the non pre fix menu side and there was 3 things on the menu we liked and the waiter then tells us that they were all out of those 3 items which were all their signature items. Don't you think on the busiest restaurant day of the year you would be stocked up on those items instead of running out of them by 9pm?? So we ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees. We got The carpaccio and the goat cheese wontons, the carpaccio was smothered in cheese my gf said but I actually enjoyed it, the goat cheese wontons just tasted like oil and didnt have much flavor. For our entrees my gf ordered the filet mignon and i got the ahi tuna rare with wasabi mash which I make all the time. Before you listen to our outcome I just want you all to know that I am a "CHEF" here in Vegas and I don't like giving bad reviews but this could've been our worst experience since living out here in the restaurant aspect. "Salt", there was no salt on anything. Her filet mignon steak was cooked good but had no salt & pepper on it at all and her veggies were just steamed veggies that weren't seasoned. My ahi tuna has no flavor to it and the wasabi mash had way too much wasabi paste in it cause every bite i took my nose started burning. We then ordered dessert with was the salted caramel pudding and that also needed more salt to give that salty and sweet combination. The place was so understaffed its crazy. No way a meal should take 2 hrs in a restaurant. Food service was a 2/10 and food was a 1/10.. sorry just giving our honest opinions. Todd probably ran out of Salt like he did with everything else.

Amazeballs! If you have doubts about dining at Todd's, leave your doubts behind! My husband and I just had the most amazing dinner at Todd's.
Everything from the bread to the potstickers and crab cake starters were amazing.
For the entrees, I had the skirt steak "on fire" with the chile cheese fries and my husband had the ahi tuna with wasabi mashed potatoes. Both were absolutely outstanding!
For dessert, My husband had the cinnamon bread pudding--Delicious! I had McKenna's brownie--it was very good, also.
Terry C., our server, was professional, friendly and personable.
We will definitely be back.

One negative was that we were sitting under the cooling vents and were uncomfortable.  We mentioned it to our wait person and she said that is just the way it work.

The food was very good and the service was a little less.  Overall it was a nice experience.  We will be back but not take the booth in the back.

Went to have dinner at happy hour and asked to sit in the bar area. We ordered a salad and our dinners. I asked what drinks they have for happy hour and the server said happy hour is in the bar. I said we are in the bar and she said no you have to sit at the bar. What!!  There's not two seats together at the bar and why are we sitting in the bar if we can't have happy hour. Never heard of anything so stupid. It's too bad we won't be coming back.

My brother chose Todd's for his birthday dinner, leading to one of the best meals I've had since moving to Las Vegas in 2013.  First off, the service was amazing.  On arrival, we were seated promptly and presented with menus (drinks and food) and an offer of water, which was quickly delivered.  This was a theme that would continue throughout the meal, as our fantastic waitress took great care of us throughout our dining experience.

Some of us opted for cocktails (two mules and a pear martini) which were both great.  I had a mule and it was just delicious. One of the best cocktails I've had.  For apps, we (party of 5) chose the appetizer sampler, which offered an asian dumpling, some calamari, a goat cheese wonton, a crab cake, and a sweet potato puff.  Everything was great, but I particularly enjoyed the goat cheese wonton and crab cake. Dinner included a perfectly prepared salmon special, the seared sea scallops, the NY steak, a fillet of beef, and the boneless short rib.  Everyone loved their food, but I particularly want to tell you about my dish, which was the short rib.  This was a good sized piece of meat and it just melted in your mouth.  So delicious.  The jalapeno mash and onion sauce were a perfect compliment to this delicious entr√©e.

For desert, my parents split a nutella cr√®me brulee, my brother had the chocolate cake, my sister-in-law had the bread pudding (which was big enough for at least two people and delicious), and I went with the amazing bananas foster.  My brother also got a special complimentary birthday desert (tiramisu).  Everything was thoroughly enjoyed.

Overall, this place is amazing and quite reasonably priced for such high end fare.  I cannot recommend Todd's Unique Dining enough, and can see being a regular visitor.

Don't let the simple, subdued logo fool you. Todd's is a nice establishment. Not too classy and not too pricey, but with food at that epicurean level and a more casual, relaxed feel. 

I've tried 3, maybe 4, entrees and each one was superb. The shirt ribs stood out the most to me. You know how people say slow-cooked meat falls off the bone or,  even further, melts in your mouth? But it doesn't actually melt in your mouth, does it?* Well... this one virtually does. You don't need a knife. 


*surely there are exceptions, but I mean it as a hyperbolic statement.

WINNING! Charlie may talk about it, but Todd pulls it off. Stopped by for the first time on my last trip to Vegas. Loved the rustic ambiance which was in sharp contrast to the strip mall Todd's is located in. After drinking some Tiger Blood, I mean red wine, my lady friend and I enjoyed a pretty tasty meal. The salad was good. The lobster special was sinfully delicious. The bread pudding was om nom nom nom. The only disappointing thing for me was the amount of fat on the skirt steak. I don't normally order skirt steaks, so maybe it's always that fatty? Not sure. I did, however, enjoy the sauce on the steak. Last but not least, our server was friendly and informative...just the way it should be. Till next time!
