I'm way behind on my reviews. This one is from Spring Restaurant Week '12. Dining out at any half-decent, upscale place should be relaxing. That wasn't the vibe I got as we entered. It was a madhouse with servers and hostesses running around frantically with overwhelmed and panicked looks on their faces. Granted, it was a Saturday night during restaurant week, but I've seen plenty of places handle the rush much better.

The waiting area by the host stand is only large enough for about four people to stand. Any more than that and you'll feel like you're in the way. It's probably best to wait outside if you can.

Luckily, the table we were seated at was away from all the commotion. The interior of the restaurant feels dated -- the kind of dark greens and browns that remind me of a cheap hotel.

As for the food, it wasn't bad. We both opted for the RW menu, starting off with the sweet corn ravioli, which could have used more sauce and some acidity to cut through the sweetness of it.

The filet medallions were a fairly large size, but the quality of the beef was tougher than expected. The roast prime rib of pork was a massive chunk of meat that was as tender as a pork chop could be. The accompanying mashed potatoes were delicious and the cabbage added a welcoming bit of crunch to the meal.

The desserts were the highlight of the meal. The flourless chocolate cake was rich and sweet and the perfect size to satisfy your sweet tooth without making you feel like you overindulged. The butterscotch pudding was similar to a budino but wasn't as creamy or silky smooth. 

After hearing so many good things about this place, my expectations were high. Unfortunately, Todd's Unique Dining wasn't able to meet them. The food was pretty good all the way around, but lacked the wow factor of more acclaimed spots around town. The flavors of most of the dishes were solid, but the presentation looked a little dated. Even compared to other high-end, off the strip restaurants, I'd rate Todd's well below both Marche Bacchus and Vintner Grill.

The experience on Valentine's Day Dinner was just OK -

The staff though is very nice. The server accomodated to a switch of side as requested. 

The food took too long. 

They had ran out of calamari - we did have an 830p reservation. So it was rather late for a holiday sort of night.

My lamb was perfectly cooked - it was rather delicious. 

The glass of wine wasn't badly price and was complimentary to my lamb. 

Decor was cozy.

Will try again.

We came here for Restaurant Week to support Three Square and found an amazing restaurant that we will continue coming back to. The entire wait staff was friendly and prompt. Literally everything we ate was absolutely delicious. I do not give five stars easily nor often. This place earned it this evening!

I was really hoping to have a great experience here.  I may have just been there on a bad night. Firstly, we ordered the samosas, we bit into a block of ice.  Obviously these were pulled from the freezer and not heated properly.  My wife had the scallops which came out chewy and extremely salty! My skirt steak was was ok, but over seasoned as well.  I had such high hopes from word of mouth reviews, it only made it more disappointing.

If you aren't a regular, you won't be well taken care of. 

After yelping this place, I suggested it to my girlfriends before we went to see a movie at green valley galaxy. We decided to grab seats at the bar since we only had about an hour before our show and the bar was wide open. The restaurant is pretty small and the bar only had 10 chairs. We took up 7 of those. 

This was all of our first time trying this place and we were excited to see they had a great happy hour menu but that's where the excitement ended. Our bartender Mark was incredibly busy. We didn't get to order anything until he was finished making three other rounds of drinks and almost TWENTY minutes had passed. 

At this point happy hour was over and so Mark let us know if we wanted something we had to put it in quickly. We all ordered cocktails and food, including a bottle of wine, a few glasses of wine, a vodka tonic, tuna tartar, cheese plate, grilled cheese, wontons, bacon wrapped dates, etc, but once again had long wait times for our orders. One of my girlfriends was served twenty minutes after the rest of us for a glass of wine and two appetizers!

While Mark was rushing around working hard, I noticed the gentleman sitting next to me was incredibly well taken care of by the wait staff up until he left. While we waited twenty minutes just for waters this guys plate and glass were always full because a female server was constantly checking on him. I found this to be odd as Mark clearly looked like he was struggling to keep up with all if the bar orders, and didn't get any help. We weren't even acknowledged by anyone else.

Once that man at the bar left a little while later I noticed two older gentlemen enter the restaurant and walk over to the bar. Seeing that there was only one seat available, as a couple had taken the other two, they proceed to get a table instead. 
This is when I overheard Terry (apparently part owner) completely ream Mark for not taking care of the regulars while he was trying to help serve us! She was mad at him for not helping these two guys out even though there was clearly nothing he could do. I was so offended that within ear shot of me she was bashing us for taking up the bar seats. How incredibly rude! 

We won't be coming back here or recommending this place but they probably don't want new business anyway seeing as Terry was verbally bashing us seven new paying customers within hearing distance.

I had had a company dinner here before our annual convention an was impressed. driving by here it's possible to miss as there is no flair or flashing light to lure you in, just good reviews and excellent food. 
 I had read they are know for their seafood so I went with the scallops and mushroom risotto. Scallops were seared perfectly, cooked to perfection and the risotto was equally as good. It was nice to have more than just a few scallops per order, they actually plated nine on my plate making it a very filling dish.
The service was top notch. We had one server for our group and she was on top of all of our drink orders, nobody had to wait for a refill the entire evening and we had several rounds.

Not so unique dining experience indeed.

The short: looks like it used to be a Mexican restaurant, service was eh, entrees were tough, disappointing dessert :(. 

Dined here during Restaurant Week and Todd's definitely seemed to be the place with the most value, it was $30.12 for a 3 course.

The night did not start off so well beginning with reservation. Made a reservation Friday 9PM, came a bit early, and didn't get seated until 930PM. Okay no problem you're busy, but I did see empty tables in the dining room. Service was a hit and miss throughout the night, seemed to be a lot of tension between the waitress and the bussers. 

Started with a Grumpy's salad and a heirloom tomato bisque for appetizers. The tomato bisque was creamy and delicious, but the grumpy's salad was overwhelmed with cheese. For entrees we ordered the beef medallions (medium-rare) and the prime pork ribs. Both equally tough to chew, but had a very nice presentation, accompanying items didn't do much to complement flavor wise though. Lastly the desserts ordered were the hazelnut creme brulee and the salted caramel pudding. Creme brulee was disappointing and lacked the wonderful experience of breaking the torched sugar coat on top. Salted caramel pudding sweetness was overwhelming. 

All and all, I'm glad I tried it just to have it crossed off my list of to-do's, but considering it was a 30 minute drive, and so-so experience, I will probably not come back.

1st I have to say that the service was wonderful & everyone there was extremely kind & helpful. We arrived with a reservation & were promptly seated & greeted by our server. The only reason I am giving this place a 2 star review is because of the food...it just was not as good as I expected, especially for the price. Won't be back.

This was our first time at Todd's, it was a weekday so we knew it wasn't going to be crazy busy or anything. Service was good very fluent and timely. The ambiance was good, very intimate small restaurant, on a couple of occasions I had to lower my voice down as to not be too loud. The restaurant is a little outdated but it adds to its  charm I think. 

Good Wine List.... Silver Oaks always a go to. 

Let's talk food, we started with goat cheese wantons and the Seared beef carpaccio. 
wanton, were very flavorful and the capers were a nice add. The Goat Cheese wantons were moist and tasteful. We decided to go with the Ceasar salad for the greens and just split it, it was a Caesar salad, as expected. 

For our main dishes we got the scallops and the Skirt Steak "On Fire".... The scallops, pretty good, and cook correctly so was the steak... the presentation was lacking and the fact that the steak came with what looked to be just a pile of cheese fries made me question who is creating the menu. I was a little disappointed with that. 

Overall I gave it 4/5 because th food didn't jump out at me but I think I will give it another go because its so close.

Food was delicious! Server was friendly, helpful, delightful, Drinks were above average; the gal who greeted us however,  was such a downer; she never cracked a smile and gave the impression that we were bothering her. We had a reservation and we were prompt;That was disappointing.

Had dinner with My Father, Brother, and a friend. The service was impeccable!! Then the food, WOW! The Scallops with the Pistachio Butter were amazing!! The Steak was cooked to perfection!! The atmosphere is very inviting. Thank you Sheena, Dustin and Amy for your great service!! We had a wonderful evening!! Definately will be back.

Hands down one of the best dining experiences I have ever had! Ryan our server is the best! He was very attentive. If you want top shelf food and I mean top shelf, this is your place. I will always eat here when in Las Vegas! Don't waste you time or money anywhere else. Forget the strip, Todd has what you want and meets all expectations with 5 stars. Thanks to Todd's unique for some delicious food! PS request Ryan as your sever.

We were here last night for a birthday dinner with close friends. 
Impeccable service can take a great meal to amazing. Scott was attentive yet not intrusive. Spot on with timing and servicing the table. 
Todd's food preparation was a delight and his suggested wine pairings were perfection.
After having a less than stellar experience the last time we visited in June of this year we were reluctant to try Todd's again. So glad that we did! 
We will definitely be back - in fact we already have reservations for next week.
Kudos to Todd and Terri and their staff!

We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary there tonight, it was our first time eating there. I want to say the service was great and the food delicious.
I would highly recommend the appetizer Carpaccio ( steak tar tar) if you like very rare filet like I do this dish is amazing, although I would skip the salad
You get greens with the appetizer. My husband had the fish special and although I can't remember the name he really enjoyed it , I had the filet (rare) and I have to admit although a little pricey in was absolutely delicious . Would highly recommend this restaurant and I'm sure it will become our go to for special occasions .

I'm verbose, I'm loquacious, I word-smith for a living yet I do not have verbiage sufficient to describe the cavalcade of wondrous flavors I experienced a few nights ago on my first visit to Todd's.

I think the theme for the evening would have to be Surprise. You don't expect this gem to be hidden in a strip mall among chain restaurants and nail salons. When you walk in and see the simple, clean, small (the marketer in me wants to say "intimate") dining room, you don't expect the food to come out plated like a showpiece from the Food Network. And when you see the (relatively) moderate prices on the menu, you certainly don't expect a 5-star dining experience. Yet in each of these assumptions I was surprised - pleasantly surprised. 

From the signature Asian dumplings, to the seafood chowder, then a plate of sea scallops that left me perfectly satisfied yet desperately craving three more portions - just for the flavor - I could not have asked for more. 

Then came the dessert menu!  We opted for a pineapple-apple cobbler with a cinnamon gelato topping. Again, as was par for the evening, the flavors were sumptuous  - a perfectly balanced mix of rich dark seasonings and bright fruity sugars. 

 My wife and I both enjoyed our 4-course meal immensely and got out for under $100... can't complain about that. We went two days ago, and are already looking for an excuse to go back. St. Patrick's Day maybe?

An amazing menu, wonderfully prepared and expertly served.  Sorry that it took us so long to find it. The only draw back is that their wine list is pricey, so we decided to enjoy the wine by the glass.   I wish they would sell Todd's wines by the bottle.

Our last dining experience with Toods was over Thanksgiving. The food was great, in-fact it was very good. The service was friendly and over all-good quality.

I few negatives about our experience, one they added gratuity automatically to our bill for a party of 2. I found this offensive, when automatically added its called a service charge not a gratuity.  In my case, I added another 20%, not noticing it, as they still had a line on the bill labeled "gratuity"... not additional gratuity.  The staff said nothing, when the bill was returned my dinner mate pointed out that..... I had tipped 40%. I had been ripped off. 

The second point, the bartender was overheard talking about Tood guests to other guests sitting at the bar, about how drunk this guest was, which guy toy that guest was with, how much makeup another guest had on.... it was embarrassing and class-less. I would have fired the bartender on the spot. But the thing is, other staff seemed to accept it, which gave me the feeling they do it often. 

Recap - good food, good food service.... class-less bar staff. Lame auto gratuity - service charge policy.
Adorable small restaurant with a small restaurant feel. Employees take great pride in their work.

OK this place is very good. Have the flank steak was absolutely delectable with some really cool fries. It's not the least expensive that I have run into however you will not be disappointed with the quality of the meal

you know, todds just never disappoints...from the first moment you step in, the greeting is warm, the seating is great...the intimate feel...then the libations, watermelon martini-truly delightful, the wine selection, great and by the glass very nice!  the food, oh the food...always delicious...the serve staff-truly friendly without any stuffiness...one of my very favorite places to be!
Delicious food, great atmosphere, reasonably priced. Scallops with mushroom mashed potatoes were superb!!!

My wife and I recently moved to the North Green Valley area and we were eager to try out some of the restaurants in our area. We stumbled upon Todd's via Yelp. We had from friends/co-workers about how great this place was but never really had a chance to go. Well, last week we finally did and we were impressed. 
First off, while the location and restaurant decor may seem a tad ordinary and boring, the food is NOT!! We went on a Monday and it was fairly slow so we were seated right away. The waiter let us know about the specials and then let us peruse the menu. For appetizers we opted for the goat cheese wontons and a salad that we would both share. For the main course, I opted for the NY Strip steak while my wife had the Filet. Our meal started with the won tons and the spinach salad with almonds and blueberries. My wife and I planned on sharing it so the waiter offered to split it, which was nice. The salad was amazing and the won tons were divine! So good that when the fifth one was left on the plate, my wife said, "Should we split that last one?" to which I replied, "Of course!!" Our main dishes were fabulous. Our steaks were cooked just right. I paired my steak with a wine that the waiter recommended and it was perfection! All in all, we both rated our meals "five-stars."
About the only gripe I would have would be the portions. My main entree was huge while my wife's looked much smaller. It ended up working out perfectly for both of us, but had our orders been reversed, it would have been disappointing. But don't let that minor quibble prevent you from visiting. We look forward to our next visit to Todd's Unique Dining.

Continuing the theme of previous post, this is another "old" review.

For whatever reason, I tried to come up with a "local" joint in Las Vegas that my friend (who lived there her whole life minus college years) did not know/hear about.  After some poking around the internet, I came up with this place (if I remember correctly, on citysearch).

From what I can remember, it's not too terribly far from the strip area.  But then again, I wasn't driving and we may have left from her house, not the hotel... so my estimate could be way off.  Check the map =D

While I liked the "local" feel of the restaurant (this was my first not-on-strip dining experience in Vegas), I didn't think the food was all that great.  Don't get me wrong, it wasn't like bad food... just nothing special.  And for tourists, it's definitely not worth it to drive/cab off the strip to dine here.

I wasn't a huge fan of this place. Maybe it was the limited menu on Valentines day. We arrived 15 minutes prior to our reservation time. we were seated shortly after our set time. I would say this is a restaurant that is VERY popular with the older crowd. The choice was small.. option wise of the menu.
but I will give it another shot on a non-holiday!! The bartender, hostess and servers were all friendly. but the wait time for the food was a little long.

The Quality of the food. was good. I enjoyed my steak and veggies. 
They accept cash and credit cards.

I had big expectations. People love this place. I liked it.  I was told I had to get the wonton appetizer. It was good but the sauce was too sweet. That seemed to be the theme throughout the meal: overly sweet sauces that over powered the dish.  Service was good. Ambiance was very similar to the Italian restaurant that was in there years ago.

*** Review is for Restaurant Week 2018 Menu ***

I've been going to try Todd's Unique for a couple of years on recommendations from some friends.  I chose this for my first Restaurant Week 2018 dinner.

There is one menu online for $30.18 but they have a second for $40.18 when you go there with some more choices.  I went with the higher priced menu.  For my three courses, I ordered:  beef carpaccio with lemon oil and parmesan, boneless short rib, and what they call "Killer chocolate cake and blackberry sauce."

I was brought my iced tea quickly by Sheena, my server, and she refilled the glass several times during the meal.  She told me the bread would be out of the oven shortly and she brought me a bread basket with two slices of garlic bread and two pieces of focaccia with soft butter.

In a short time she brought me my appetizer of beef carpaccio.  Standard carpaccio except for the lemon oil squeezed over the beef.  There were also some greens for a small salad with the beef.  Not a bad starter.

The boneless short rib was very good.  It was tender, no knife needed--the way it should be.  The beef was on a small bed of mashed potatoes and it was steaming hot when brought to the table.  The gravy was very rich.

Dessert was a bit of a let down.  I expected a "killer" of a cake.  What I got was a small round dish with chocolate cake (not a killer by any means) and it had some blackberry jelly in the center that melted in the warm cake.  It was OK but it was no killer.

I'm glad I finally made it to Todd's.  I am intrigued by two items on their regular menu.  It may be worth a trip back to try one of those.  

Service was excellent.  Sheena was my main server but there was another woman there who seated me and got the dinner started.

My wife and I tried this place out to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. I'm always a little weary when it comes to "unique" dining since I'm a fan of the old ways. This restaurant truly shocked me and the food was great. The staff were very friendly and even surprised us with a mini dessert gift for our anniversary. My wife and I plan on coming back here whenever we're in the mood for semi-fine dining or celebrations

First of all, I love Todd's because the food is excellent, the service is excellent, and it's a fancy restaurant that's locally owned and down the street from my house. I love that they host wine and beer dinners regularly and that the menu is constantly rotating. I also enjoy that Todd has come out and made the rounds every time we've been in. It feels like a true local spot.

However, I have one comment to Todd/staff. My husband wanted to do something special for his bday this year, so we attended the February wine dinner (apologies for my tardiness in this review). The food was really good (until dessert, which was just ok), but the wines kinda sucked. Also, it was no bargain - at $120/head, it was one of Todd's pricier wine dinners.

Not sure if it was the fault of Todd or the winemaker, but I think it's tough for anybody to do an entire meal pairing consisting of only zinfandel blends. It's probably my own fault for not doing more research on the winery/wines to see what we would be having, but I put full trust in Todd. We were treated to scallops (yum) paired with a zin blend (weird). Salad with a zin blend. Salmon with a zin blend, short ribs with a zin blend, and finally a cannoli with a zin blend. Honestly, I tried the last 2 wines just to see if something had changed. I was so so so excited leading up to this dinner. The food and service did not disappoint, but the wines fell way short. Too bad!

It needs to be said.  This place looks like your grandma's tacky vacation home.  But if you can get past the terrible decor and less than stellar atmosphere, the food is really, really good.  Probably 4.5 stars, but I'm feeling generous!  

Started with the calamari and grumpy's salad.  Both were solid.  For my entree, I had the Ahi tuna with wasabi mashed potatoes.  Holy awesome ahi.  This was so good.  The tuna was cooked perfectly.  The potatoes were creamy with just the right amount of wasabi.  The price of this culinary suprise was a welcome change from the exorbitant prices you find on the strip.  I rarely venture out into Henderson anymore, but I may make the trip more frequently for Todd's.  Seriously though, the color scheme has got to go.

We stayed in Henderson at the M Hotel for the first time and decided to try someting off strip.  We were very glad we made this decision.  It was by far our best meal in vegas.   Outstanding service, presentation and taste.  Don't let the location and the basic initial appearance of the place cause you to second guess this place -- OUTSTANDING.

We had the Steak with Black Bean Chili sauce and fries -- very spicy and very good.  Also had Sea Bass with jalapeno mashed potatoes and that was wonderful too.  The Won Ton and Dumpling appetizers were fantastic as was the "Grumpy" salad.   We were rushed a little to get to a show and didnt get to stay for the final dessert but they had a cobbler and some bread pudding that sounded great.

Todd even came out and greeted us and we very friendly and down to earth.  Appreciated his personal touch.  

Highly recommend this place!!!!!!!!

We were in town for Thanksgiving and staying off the strip for a change so I wanted to use that as an opportunity to try a good local's place. Did some quick research on my phone and I was reminded of Todd's and that I've been wanting to try it for a while. 
The place is in some random strip mall as many Vegas places are. Nothing too impressive about that or the decor. As people mentioned earlier, it is a little old school 80s but it didn't really bother me too much. It was definitely pretty packed for a Saturday night. 
We ordered the much hyped goat cheese won-tons to start. They were pretty good but honestly not as unique as I was thinking they would be. I'm a huge goat cheese fan but these honestly didn't taste too different than regular cream cheese won-tons I've had at other places. 
Its been a few months now so I can't remember too clearly what I ordered but I believe it was some type of fish. I know I cleaned my plate and it was good but nothing too memorable. Same reaction for dessert. 
That being said, the service here was great. Todd is always there working as the chef which is very rare in strip restaurants. His wife was our server and she was very friendly, telling us the story of how Todd started the restaurant and all the places he worked before. We definitely appreciated this personal touch. 
All in all, this wasn't a bad dining experience however it didn't really live up to my expectations. Perhaps its because I've had such great experiences at other off strip Vegas dining spots such as Firefly and Grimaldi's. If I lived in Henderson, perhaps I would go to this place again. I might even hit it up if I'm in the area. However since I wasn't blown away, I think next time I have the chance to dine off strip I might use the opportunity to go somewhere I haven't tried.

We went to Todd's for my birthday, we came away very happy and will return in the future.  I'd like to give 5 stars all around but because of a couple of technical hiccups, 4 is probably more accurate on the night we visited:

We brought our own wine, Wednesday being free corkage night as long as it's not a bottle they have on the list.  It turned out their list was pretty decent, and moderate prices, not the crazy markups quite common these days.

We started with the dumplings, 5 or 6 delicious super thin wrapped pot-stickers with a soy dipping sauce.  Yummo!

Next the waiter happily split a Caesar salad for us.  Not very big portions and fairly bland, but a good segue to the main course.

My girlfriend got the New Zealand Blue Nose Bass in a light caper and artichoke sauce, hold the capers.  Unfortunately the fish was a little overcooked, but as a meal with the veggies and mash it was still delicious.

I got the "skirt steak on fire".  I'm English, the hottest curries in the U.S. wouldn't even count as mild in England, but WOW, this skirt steak was HOT.  It comes with chili fries with black bean sauce, sounds crazy but it works.  Deeee-licious.  However, I asked for it medium rare but it came out too rare, making some of the steak a bit stringy and tougher.  I didn't send it back, but would probably go nearer medium next time.

For dessert the birthday boy was given a free, but little, take on Tiramisu, an excellent end to a "Unique" meal.

It's not so easy these days to find a chef willing to be creative and take a few risks.  Not perfect execution on the night we went, but still plenty good enough for us to return.
Dinner was delicious, as Todd always does a great job in the kitchen. If the surf and turf is available, try it.

I've eaten here a couple of times, and each time the dining room was packed.  We overdid it a little bit on our last visit, two covers coming to about 250 with the tip, but the experience was great.  Our food and server were excellent.  Todd came out towards the end of our meal and chatted us up, letting us know about his menu and some upcoming events.  Great off-strip locals dining if you are willing to set aside the dated decor and focus on the food and service.

We found Todd's via the Internet. We were tired of dining on the strip.  Whack, home run. It is an easy drive and easy to navigate to from the strip. My wife had a steel-head trout special and I had very spicy skirt steak.  It used a fair amount of peppers and was hot but not overpowering.   Both were delicious.  The chef is very creative with spicing and presentation.  

Also worth the short trip was the "Grumpy's Blue Cheese Iceberg Salad".  Shredded iceberg with onion slices, tomatoes and chunks of blue cheese with a mayonnaise sauce.  

The place was packed, so we ended up seated for dinner at the bar.  The other diners were local residents and really spoke highly of the Todd's. 

We will eat here again on our next trip to Las Vegas.
Love this place.  Great for a celebration or simply a nice dinner,  phenomenal  wine list.  The short rib was so tender and meaty. The menu was varied and the service was  superb.
Todd's Unique Dining was such an amazing experience m. Food was perfect, atmosphere was awesome and the service was amazing. Great secret place!

I had been wanting to go to Todd's for quite a while.  I had heard so many wonderful things about it.  My husband and I were a little underwhelmed.  The appetizers and cocktails were fabulous!  The crab cake with curry sauce was delicious.  The ahi tuna was fantastic and the goat cheese wontons were yummy. My husband ordered the Whiskey Smash cocktail and I ordered the watermelon martini, both were excellent.  I had the beet salad, which was mediocre.  For dinner I had the spare ribs, which tasted like a regular old pot roast.  My husband had the halibut.  It was dry and overcooked.  All in all it was a nice dinner.  I would go back for cocktails and appetizers, but not for dinner.  With so many amazing restaurants in Las Vegas, this one missed the mark a bit.

After finding out that all of my 'friends' had other family in to spend thanksgiving with I found myself with the situation of fending for myself on thanksgiving dinner so I made a reservation to partake in Todd's Prix fix special event Thanksgiving Menu.

I arrived a half hour early and contemplated sitting in the car or entering... I ended up entering and the hostess who was very nice told me that she'd have me seated in 5 minutes. 

After I was seated I was promptly greeted by my waitress Kylee R. she was very friendly and accommodating and even though I was by myself she made me feel welcome. 

I ordered an Ice tea which had tropical flavorings added it seemed bitter at first but sugar made it taste way better.

I went with the butternut squash soup based on Kylee's Recommendation and I have to agree that it was very fantastic, flavorful and you could taste that hint of honey and truffle in the background of the main ingredients. I liked it.

I of course had to choose the Free Range Petaluma Organic Hand carved Roast Turkey Dinner that came with White and Dark Roasted Turkey, Giblet Gravy, Sweet sausage stuffing, roasted Brussels sprouts, haricot vert, mashed potato and brown sugar sweet potatoes since it didn't seem right to order a steak tonight. 

The turkey was melt-in-your mouth delicious, and the giblet gravy was fantastic. I of course asked for an extra helping of gravy because I'm one of those people that likes to make sure it's dead and drowned in the stuff!

I found the 'sweet' sausage stuffing to be abnormally spicy though and it actually put a stop to my dinner for a moment as I must have gotten a really spicy piece of sausage that managed to make it's way into the 'sweet' batch... Either that or TODD is trying to be unique by saying it's "sweet" and instead watching you spit fire while he giggles in his office watching the cameras.... 

The mashed taters sweet potatoes Brussels Sprouts and Haricot Vert were good and flavorful as well. My only gripe is that it says "sprouts" and not sprout! I could have eaten another three or twenty of them, it was that good! 

Dessert was a Crisp Cinnamon Apple Tart and Pumpkin Pie Timbale which both were of course fantastic and I was stuffed and finished at the end of this... 

So why the 1 star off you might be asking? well it's quite simple... I am not a fan of loud boisterous cursing every minute (GD this and GD that and F this and No S that.) there was a table with an extremely loud overly intoxicated individual that was clearly thinking that he was at his house instead of out in public and none of the employees let him know that his language or boisterous exaggerations were inappropriate. there should have been some kind of customer control going on there, Kylee had mentioned it and apologized to me that it was happening before I left and I accepted it and thanked her very much.

Overall-This experience was great though and I would like to return on a non-holiday to try the regular menu, so thanks Todd, and Kylee for providing this soul a good thanksgiving meal when it had nowhere else to go. (Pictures added)

I came here some time ago for dinner with my husband. I had wanted to try Todd's for some time, checking out their website and drooling over the video demos they have. 
I must say that the dining room looks kind of dated and the booth where we sat was not very comfortable. But I was encouraged to see that everybody seemed to be having a great time so I relaxed. 

We started off with the goat cheese wonton which was super good, then I chose skirt steak for my entr√©e and the hubby chose the short rib. Both were fantastic. The skirt steak is frickin' awesome, they serve it with chili cheese fries, holy cow! This dish is hearty hearty! We both ordered cocktails cannot recall which ones, and neither of us liked them. I would say be safe and choose beer or wine. Anyway, who orders chili cheese fries, steak and a cocktail? Get a beer dammit!

What I found particularly thoughtful is that Chef Clore came out an stopped at every table throughout the evening to check and see how their meal was, including ours. It's that fantastic service that will keep people coming back to the restaurant.
So cute it's such a gem absolutely loved it great food and service was like being on the strip but very quaint great for dates

I would give Todd's more than five stars if that was an option. This has been my favorite restaurant in town since I moved to Las Vegas two years ago. It's my favorite for not only food, but for the consistently great service.

I've never had anything here that was less than excellent. My favorite entree is the skirt steak on fire. To die for! It is the spice and flavor I crave with a nice tender steak. The fries served alongside complement the steak nicely. All of the desserts are amazing, but the butterscotch pudding is my favorite because it's not only delicious, but unique as well. I love that the cobbler flavors change seasonally and make a nice finish to a meal as well. The scallop entree is quite remarkable as well, perfectly prepared with a tasty sauce applied in the perfect amount. The drinks are always delicious as well. When watermelon is seasonal they make a great watermelon martini with fresh watermelon.

I hate to be one of the few people that wasn't overly impressed here. I heard about this place years ago and finally came in and perhaps my expectations were overly high but I was completely underwhelmed. I ordered the beef carpaccio and the scallops and both were rather bland and uninspiring. Others in my dining party really enjoyed themselves, one ordered the Mahi Mahi special and was very pleased with it, the other ordered the Meatloaf and really raved about it. I will say that the staff was amazing and really on the ball with everything so definitely no complaints at all with that.
Consistently great service and food quality! We are big fans of Todd's and can always count on having a great experience. The tuna is my favorite entree.
There is a reason Todd cooks in Henderson and not in LV.  That said, the food was passable, but nothing extraordinary or unique.

My husband & I went here on a Tuesday night around 7pm, and the place was PACKED. We didn't have a reservation so we had to sit at the bar. I took this to be a really good indication of the food.

The restaurant itself seemed to be in an odd location. Sort of in a strip mall. So, nothing flashy about it, but looks can be SO decieving!!!

The service is some of the absolute BEST I have ever seen. Every single person that passed us while we were waiting to be seated asked if we had been helped. And, since we ended up sitting at the bar, we got to see that Mark (the bartender) knew many of the patrons by name as well as their "usual" orders. I thought that was pretty impressive!

So, the food. I ordered a teryaki halibut whic came with coconut rice & baby bok choy. I asked to sub the bok choy for mashed sweet potato & they mixed it up and sub'd the rice instead. I was a little sad about missing out on the rice because I had been looking forward to trying it, but I didn't have them correct it. The fish, was OUTSTANDING!! It was a good size portion, cooked perfectly, great flavor. Hands down one of my top 10 meals EVER.

My husband had the "steak on fire" which was skirt steak marinated in various peppers & served with fries. I didn't try it since I am not into spicy, but he loved it.

I had a cantaloupe martini which was awesome. For these 2 dishes & drink (along w/ soda & iced tea) came to about $80...and worth EVERY penny!!

CHECK OUT TODD'S!!!

I've been here 5 times, how did I forget to review it?  Unforgivable!

the quick:
love love love the food. the food is my master!
friendly, courteous and feels like family!
very quaint restaurant, good for special occasional or casual upscale dining!

Thanks OpenTable for helping find Todd's!  Being off the strip it's hard to come upon this eatery at random.

Todd's Skirt Steak & Black Bean Chili Fries.  This is all that needs to be said. Get it. It's good, so very good.

I stacked my friends and brought them out here as well and everyone was quite happy with what they ordered.  The menu changes from season to season so it's difficult to say what is great to have but the skirt steak is a staple of his menu.  Other items I recall having are wasabi mash which is quite tasty and the ahi tuna tar tar, which is served on crispy rice squares.  Very good as well.

Todd's isn't the least expensive option available to you but the food is top notch for what you pay.  I've always been happy when I left.  Thanks for great food and great service!
Great place hidden in small strip.  Real local joint, though there is no doubt lots of locals have no idea this is here!!!
Todd's always lives up to its name...VERY UNIQUE!!  I love it here.  The food, the service, the atmosphere are always as good as it gets!

On a recent busy weekend evening, when I complained that I'd waited 15 minutes for the appetizer, apparently a head waitress curtly informed me it "had only been 10 minutes, I know, I timed it".  When I questioned this unbelievable response, she gave me "an excuse me?".  I almost walked out.  This woman should have been fired on the spot. 

The food is good, but on the night I was there, the service was rushed, impersonal, rude (see above), and not appropriate for the pretentiousness of the menu.

Todd's is a welcome change from Strip mega-restaurants, but the space on weekends is too small, the servers can be harried, and the experience less than optimal.

The prices are high, which probably give the average Henderson/Las Vegas diner some comfort that  are truly dining high-end.  However, gourmet dining involves more than a creative, expensive menu.  It must also include a comfortable, relaxed space:  my seat was under a very cold vent which was slow to be turned down even after I complained.  Comfort is not something the customer should have to ask for at these prices!  The servers should be relaxed and confident, but mine was harried and inexperienced.  The kitchen was slammed and pretty far behind.   

Hey Todd, remove some tables, add some senior servers and tell them to slow down and relax, don't rudely confront the guests when the kitchen is under pressure, and Todd's would be a better place, especially during high volume times.

As stated by an earlier review of Todd's (see below), the thing this tight little place is lacking is ambience and genuine warmth.

My husband and I met his sister and her husband here for dinner when we were in Vegas for a brief break over Christmas. 

One caveat:  Due to illness, I was unable to drink and my diet was a bit restricted.  That said, here's what we experienced. 

Great service. Good wine recommendations (I didn't drink, the rest of the table did).  

I had never had steelhead before, had always wanted to try it, and asked the waiter  if I should have that or the regular trout, telling him that I didn't like fishy fish.  He said the steelhead was a better choice.  I was pretty impressed!  Very good, mild fish. I'd compare to a mild salmon. Not over cooked. Well presented.  My husband had the short ribs:  fantastic fall off the bone meat.  Hubby and shared a dessert, which, I cannot for the life of me remember. 

Suffice to say, nice spot. Tucked into a strip mall.  We'd come back if back in the area.   

Oh and it was pretty quiet for such a small place.  Not a place for kids, IMO.

An eclectic restaurant.   Remember when you were taught to eat a balanced meal?  They usually don't serve a balanced meal.  Maybe if they offered some sides (eg mac&cheese, green beans, asparagus. twice baked potato) the meals you get there could be real meals instead of the scimpy partial meals  you often get.

They offer a caesar salad.  It should be offered as "Hearts of Romaine with a non-caesar dressing but with an Italian Vinegerrete. IOW, their caesar salad is very serious disappointing if you like regular caesar salad.

One of my foodie friends has always chastised me for not trying this restaurant and I finally tried it last night. I am so glad I did. It's small and it was a little warm when we got there but I am so glad I went. First we started with the wontons which were really amazing. I don't normally like wontons but these were crispy and savory and were really good. I got the short rib which is a favorite of mine to order at restaurants especially when the meat is as tender as it was a Todd's. But I really really have to say that this portion was humongous one of the biggest portions of short ribs I have ever seen. I was so happy to eat it last night and I'll be happy to eat it again tomorrow night. It came with jalapeno mash potatoes which I don't know how Todd did this but he managed to get all of the flavor of jalapeno and not an over amount of the spice of the jalapeno. One of the best things I have ever tasted in my life. When I asked for my meal to be boxed I really really wanted to box it myself because I have this strange feeling that I'm the only one that could box it exactly the way I wanted it and I wanted every drop of that delectable sauce in my box. I just have to trust that they got it all in for me. We had two desserts to share between five people it was the brownie and the peach cobbler. I will come back to Todd's because the menu was fantastic it changes seasonally I was told by the waitress who was incredibly knowledgeable and very attentive and I am dying to try the scallops!!!!

Hadn't been back in years but decided to give it a try during restaurant week last evening.
Enjoyed a great meal that was very nicely priced  along with excellent service.  
We won't wait so long next time. Ciao

Went here for the first time a week or so ago on a recommendation. Was not disappointed. I had the signature skirt steak and fries which isn't how your mom made it, very flavorful, spicy, I couldn't finish  the plate but wanted to. My wife had the scallops which was also fantastic. Don't let the location fool you, if in Vegas GO!!

I've eaten here for the past eight years.  The food and service is as good as just about anywhere on the Strip.  I have a hard time straying from the Kobe Short ribs but when I do, I'm still very pleased.   The Martinis here are unbelievable too.
While the food was okay, it was nothing outstanding and it certainly didn't seem unique - except for dessert size which was uniquely huge...

Owner/chef Todd Clure celebrated the restaurant's 11th year anniversary by sending out $20 off 2 entrees' coupons via emails to his regulars including yours truly. We received a bread basket with 2 types of butter. We next shared a pear and blue cheese salad that included cranberries with a fig balsamic dressing that proved to be refreshing.  Todd is noted for bringing in seasonal fresh fish and so my wife ordered the evening's special of Pacific swordfish with couscous.  My entree was Alaskan halibut in an artichoke and caper sauce accompanied by bok choy and a decorative mix of fresh herbs and vegetables.  Hers was very good, mine was excellent.

I had a multimillionaire take me here for a business meeting after wanting to list his home. 
I loved it! 
I will forever remember these amazing cream cheese duck wontons 
It was the highlight of my week! 
I ordered a fish dinner and orange Grey goose 

I have wanted to come back and tried to replicate the wontons 
Didn't work out well 

This is a nice hole in the wall. 
I liked this very much! 
I believe my client had ordered fish 
I don't remember 
I did find parking 

Right in front 
Service was good, he was a young Latino man. 
And man those wontons!!!!!!! Ugh 
Amazing 
Must order

Thank goodness for Yelp... I drive by this place everyday but if it weren't for Yelp, I never would have come across it! My husband and I were looking for a new place for a date night that we hadn't already been to a million times and didn't have to spend $500 to enjoy ourselves! We came across Todd's Unique Dining on Yelp and after seeing their great reviews, decided to try it out! What an amazing dinner we had! The restaurant has dimmed lighting (very romantic), our service was amazing and our food was perfectly cooked.
Even though this place might not catch your eye as you drive by it, it is definitely worth dining at!

I remember this place being ALOT better the first time I  tried it a few years ago. This time it was just OK. First of all, this restaurant is not kid friendly at all.  I wish we would've known that bc they didn't even have a high chair for our 1 year old so he had to stand in the booth with us the whole time.  I had the steak on fire. It was just OK. He had the short rib. It was just OK. We had a couple of apps too, but I can't remember what. And that is kinda how our  meal was... Forgettable. For dessert we had some kind of salted caramel custard thing. It was waaay too sweet.  I don't think we'll be going back. 3 stars is being generous.

There was much hype to this restaurant from friends and reviews and I looked forward to eating at Todd's with friends.
Decor and presentation of all the foods were great!  
Hubby ordered the short ribs and I the sea bass with the Ahi Tuna tartar as the appetizer...desert was the wonderful bread pudding.
Waiter and service was great, too!
My friends and hubby would probably give Todd's 4 stars.  If I knew how to put 1/2 a star, I would rate it 3.5 stars.
The problem?  The Sea Bass was overcooked and dry.  I did not like it at all.  
I would probably go back and give them another try.  I know hubby would go again...

Great food and friendly people here. I have had their halibut and several of their salads before. Everything tasted great. This is a good spot for a date or for a nicer family outing. Intimate dining room. Ask for a booth when you make your reservation!

I had the pleasure of dining here on Valentine's Day. Even though there was a wait with a reservation, that was offset by the professional, friendly staff. The menu features familiar favorites with a twist. We started off with the dumplings. They had great flavor. Then we ordered pork chops and the salmon for the entrees. The pork chops were great, and the salmon was absolutely decadent. 5 star food, 4 star wait. I'll definitely return!

I've been twice now. The food is good. Nothing spectacular. The wine list is fabulous.

I was horrified when I found out that the butter they brought with the bread was not butter, but half-margarine and half-butter. When I go to a gourmet restaurant, I expect real butter. I can't imagine why they would go to the trouble to make a special concoction of butter/margarine whip.  Margarine is just a few molecules from plastic. 

To their credit, when I asked the waiter to bring out real butter, he did. 

The whole margarine thing makes me wonder what else they are doing in the kitchen.

With all the other great restaurants in Vegas, I don't see a reason to eat at Todd's. If they nix the margarine, I would go back.

I have been wanting to go here for years and decided it was a great place for date night. This place is truly a hidden gem.

The server was very friendly and helpful.

We had the Razor Clams special as an appetizer, its one of my favorite foods in the world. He treated them with so much respect. They were perfectly cooked and wonderful.

I had the duck and she had the halibut. Both were also perfectly cooked.

The waitress came out with some Brachetto as an after dinner drink which was a great touch

We will be back again for sure!

Had our wedding dinner here with a few friends and it was amazing! We spent a good amount of time choosing a place that met our needs: great tasting food, ambiance fit for an event as special as our wedding, and a location close to our local posse.  Reading about how Todd started the business was also perfect.  Supporting local talent is always a good goal.  The wine list was an exceptional illustration of great taste paired with sensible value.  They even had a biodynamic wine from my hometown.  A great place!

I've been there twice. Once with Mom, once with my girlfriend. Each experience was unique. Each experience provided superb service and fantastic food. Go there to enjoy a meal for a beautiful evening out.

I swear I reviewed this place, guess I forgot.  We visited a few months ago and it was great.  A small, cozy place with an old style feel.  The appetizers were amazing, including very fresh oysters.  I had the skirt steak "on fire" and it was fantastic.  It actually had some spice to it.  Everyone enjoyed the meal, the waitress was friendly and professional.  A nice place to visit in that part of town.

A+! Went here for the first time on one of their Sunday Wine Dinners and was not disappointed!! Definitely wouldn't expect the quality food that comes out of this place in a random strip mall location. I'm still DREAMING about the braised short rib and chile shrimp and grits. 


PRO TIP: Wednesday there's no corkage fee when you bring wine!

The Short ribs I had were perfect. Packed with flavor and fall of the bone good.

Make sure to start your meal with some goat cheese won-tons.

everything we had was great. We ended up playing "musical chairs" with our entrees so we could try a bit of everything because all 8 of us were raving about our food.

Go Eat Here!

Christmas Eve was a disaster. An hour wait beyond reservation time. The staff appeared overwhelmed because there were too many people. The food was OK but not worth the price. And there wasn't much of it. Left disappointed and hungry.

"Absolutely Amazing"
Last night was our 2nd time at Todd's.  We have decided that this is our go to place for special occasions or if we want an amazing meal without all the pretense of some of the restaurants on the strip.  One of the appetizer specials of the day was a gruyere onion tart....Absolutely Amazing!  For dinner I had one of the specials.....Gumbo.....consisting of three different shrimps, lobster, and a host of other goodies that made it also Absolutely Amazing!!!  For dessert I had the special of the day which was an apple cobbler with homemade cinnamon ice cream......you know what I'm going to say.....Absolutely Amazing!!!  My husband had the Grumpy Salad which he loved and he had the Gnocchi dish which he devoured!  For desert he had the bread pudding which he said was probably the best he has ever had, and he is a huge bread pudding lover.  
Our waitress, Terry, had some time to chat with us, which was very nice.  The atmosphere is casual and conducive to having a conversation without having to talk over the blaring music or other noisy distractions as you might find in some of the chain restaurants.
The key to any business is repeat business.  We will definitely be going back to Todd's for our next special occasion or for one of the beer tasting nights....or maybe we'll go back just because!

We hit up Todd's for our anniversary.  As most note, it's pretty unassuming in a strip mall location.  But, a lot of gems can be found in similar locales.  The wine list was not huge, but very reasonable.  Love being off the strip and seeing prices on wine and scotch....

Their menu changes, but I had the short rib and my wife had the scallops.  Both were winners.  The scallops were cooked perfectly, and have that velvety texture they can get.  The short rib was beyond tender.  I didn't need a fork to cut them, much less a knife.  And, the portions were REASONABLE.  We got full, but we weren't miserable.

It's a great romantic place, we will return.  Service was good, not fantastic, but also didn't take away from the meal.  I think Todd's is my new favorite off-Strip restaurant since Rosemary's closed.
Great dinner tonight. Crab wontons, crab stuffed mahi mahi, duck, soup. Great service!! Highly recommend!!

Best Ahi tuna I've ever had. Terry took amazing care of us, and the personal touch of Todd and her make it a place you'll want to come back to time and time again. 

The wasabi mashed potatoes with my entree were incredible, and the wine list extensive. 

A hidden gem in Las Vegas.

Just walking up to this office park building you are expecting a weird little place, when you walk in it only reinforces that expectation and when you open the menu things kind of change. The selections change daily so who knows what you'll see but on this Friday night everything looks good.

I ordered the Kobe short rib that you could tell was cooked right when I never touched a knife the entire time. My wife got the halibut which was equally flaky and delicious.

We had a $50 gift card and if my wife wasn't a wino I don't think we would have had to shell out anything but a tip for the attentive server.

All in all it was a great dinner and I'd reccomend this place to anyone who likes good food and doesn't care about being at a "hot spot"

Just found out about Todd's and had to try it out

Food was Great -5 Stars
Service was Good- 4 .3 Stars
No Table cloths and booth seating for 50$ a person -3 Stars 



Todd's Unique dining - Most Unique dishes in Henderson

I had been wanting to try this place since shortly after we moved to Henderson in 2010 & we finally got around to trying it last night. 
We were able to get a reservation for 6:45 about an hour before which was nice. I think we've tried to go on 2 other occasions & each time, there was no availability. 
First thing I noticed walking in was the  decor. It has a very casual, 80's diner theme & not what I was expecting for a nicer, upscale restaurant. The very nice hostess seated us in a booth which turned out to be very uncomfortable. Nothing worse than an uncomfortable booth! 
We started with the Dungeness crab cake appetizer & tuna tartar on crispy rice. The tuna was spot on, really delicious. But I think you could serve dog food to me on crispy rice & I would still think it was delicious. That crispy rice is becoming an addiction that could get very out of control! The Dungeness crab was a big disappointment. The cake itself was way too mushy & the accompanying curry sauce was too strong. It's almost like they just made the sauce & added some curry to it. I think the key to cooking/eating curry is to toast or saut√© it before using it to flavor whatever dish you're making with it. 
For dinner, hubby got the petite filet & I got the scallops. Hubby's filet was perfect, cooked exactly like he likes it, rare, & served along with pesto mashed potatoes & a delicious sauce. My scallops were good & cooked perfectly as well but my mashed potatoes were way too dry & just ended up being a disappointing afterthought. 
All in all, our meal was good but I guess I was expecting more & that always tends to leave me disappointed. We will prob try them again but I don't think we'll rush back anytime soon.

Finally was on this side of town to give it a go.

Let me start off saying that from the pictures on Yelp, I could not tell that this was a "fancy" restaurant.  What I mean, is that the setting is very low lit, and quiet.  There was only 3-4 other tables there at the time, so this could be part of the reason.  So you can understand how I felt out of place with my little one....

They do NOT expect you to bring kids....they do NOT have booster seats or highchairs.  Good thing my little foodie baby loves to eat, and is well mannered...most of the time anyways ;)

Now that I have that out of the way, on to the food!

We tried the crab cake and tuna tartare.  The crab cake was good, but I am jaded with Del Frisco's and I still order them.  The tuna tartare was good, with a little spice from the hot sauce, however the consistency of the tuna was kind of mushy, and not like the tartare that I am used to (thick cuts of fish).  This was more of a blended/smashed consistency....not bad, but it was a little distracting personally.

Went with the duck and the sea bass.  This is what they do well here!  The duck was crazy tender, and did not have the slightest "gammy" taste that one would expect with most duck.  The sauce was packed with flavor and the sides were all delicious.  The sea bass was super tender, and cooked perfectly.  The flavor was great as well!

Went with the bread pudding and it was good.  Not mind blowing, but it was good nonetheless.  We also tried some of their dessert wine on the house, which was a very nice touch.

Only other thing I would slightly complain about...the prices here are a little substantial.  I have paid quite a bit more for food, so don't get me wrong, but each app was $11-12 and most of the entrees are $25-30 each.  You are going to spend at least $50-60pp even without alcohol IMO, which to be fair is still a good deal here, but I feel like it goes a little farther elsewhere in town.

Still have to give it a go!  Maybe I will come back for a prix fixe menu

I had high hopes, went for my birthday, and it was just an okay meal.   The ambiance really ruined things.    The booths aren't comfortable...they basically force you to sit up straight.  The lighting is too bright.   The service is much slower than it should be (aka you guys could have made more on wine) the food was good, but not quite as great as I expected.
Delicious burger. Bar is cute. I will be back! It is a little pricy, so its a little more of a special occasion place.

Starting with service, very nice, attentive and quick with every thing we needed. The atmosphere was decent. The booths seemed more fitting for a cafe but the lighting was dim, the bar was pretty.

Now on to the food. I had the lamb with a beat/yam puree and it was perfect! Meat was tender, puree was smooth and the blueberry sauce complimented it all well. My husband had the jalapeno beef skirt. The meat was very well prepared with just enough heat. The fries were also good but the only critique was there could be less fries and add some vegetables.

Prices were reasonable, good wine selection too. We will be back to try other items.

I've heard a lot about Todd's before and I knew I had to try this place once and for all. Thankfully Todd is participating in Restaurant Week so I'm taking full advantage. I made reservations on a slow Thursday evening at 5pm for 2 people. My date didnt show it until 5:45pm.... so I ordered a Pear Martini in the meantime. For Restaurant Week you chose from two pricing options $30 or $40. The main different were "upgraded" appetizers and entree. Example instead of the petite fillet you can upgrade to the braised short rib. 

Service: 5/5 Everyone including the hostesses was very kind and was very patient with me while I waited 45 mins for my friend to arrive. The wait time between the appetizer and the entree was as little long but I was in good company so I didnt mind to much.

Quality vs quantity: 5/5 For the amount of food i received for $30 is crazy! Very high quality of meant for a very reasonable price.

I would recommend this restaurant and ask that you order the braised short rib. It was literally the size of my face and just fell apart because it was so tender.

I couldn't believe how close this place was to me and never dined here.  We had reservations for 6.  
The service was great and attentive. The food was delicious.  I had the rainbow trout  and it was so good.  The regular house salad was delicious, too.  And their apple cobbler with vanilla ice cream was wonderful. 

This place is wonderful to not only dine but have a relaxing dinner and to chat with your family and friends. 

I think our group ended up leaving after they closed and not one time did the employees disturb or rushed us out. Actually when we realized we were passed closing we got up to be respectful. As we chatted outside, our waitress came after us to thank us for dining with them. Very classic. 

It's located right across from TGIFridays.

We first tried this place for the $30 restaurant week meal. The service was the best service I've ever had anywhere in Las Vegas and the food was great, but not without flaws here and there. We both enjoyed grumpy's salad (like a wedge salad but already chopped up for you!) and my trout was spectacular. My husband got the steak and it was pretty bad - chewy and nothing special. Dessert was beautifully presented and tasty (a chocolate flourless cake if memory serves). Overall a 4, but not a 5 star dinner. It was $30, however, and it WAS restaurant week, so I went back a few weeks ago determined to have the 5 star evening I was determined Todd's could deliver! 

Todd's had sent out an email about how they were one of a few restaurants to get one of the first early shipments of King Crabs this year. I'm a huge crab freak, so I was more than eager to try them. They were sold in 2 or 3 lb dinners at market price ($65ish if memory serves). My husband and I shared this and it was TONS of crab. My husband's family is from Maryland my family is from New Orleans so we're pretty big on crab. Most of the buffet crabs here I find pretty disgusting, and I was eager to have a crab dinner that lived up to my standards! The crab here was phenomenal. I've had king crab many times before but this was by far the best I'd ever had. This crab was fresh off the boat (just 2 days before!) and had never been frozen. Flavor and texture was flawless. I never thought I'd eat the best crab in my life in freaking Henderson, NV, but this happens to be the case !

Other than the mediocre steak during restaurant week, everything about this place has been flawless over our 2 visits. The decor is very dated, but the service and food more than make up for it!

While the food was delicious, the service was nothing to write home about. We had a party of 5 people, and we had to wait over an hour- even though we had a reservation. The waiter was BLAH to say the least- but the food and drinks were worth every penny. It's everything else that wasn't so great. 
Living in Vegas with so many options....I'm not sure if I would go back here again.

The food is excellent- as good as any fine dining in Vegas and arguably some of the best ahi and scallops this side of town.

The staff, especially Todd and his wife Terry are generous and extremely friendly.

Totally worth a visit or 10.
I always enjoy Todd's, very fresh food .. with specialties off the beaten path.

Good food and cocktails.  The service is very good as well.  Nice choices on the menu.  Tucked in a little strip center, you could tell this was some mom and pop coffee shop at one time.  The booths are a little 90's, but the food and quietness of the place makes up for it.
The bartenders are good at what they do.  Scallops are yummy.
I never knew about this little hidden gem.  Had the Asian potstickers and the halibut which were both very good.  Service was excellent.  Will definitely be back!

I met up with family for dinner after work since I was in Henderson and have had this place bookmarked for a long time.  Although the interior isn't that marvelous, the food and service more than made up for it.

We started with goat cheese wontons with raspberry basil sauce.  It's like a better version of a crab rangoon.  I got the Togarashi Seared Ahi Tuna with Wasabi mashed potatoes.  It was sooo good.  Our family likes to share and taste each other's food.  The rest of the family got Organic Chicken Breast with couscous and 2 orders of Boneless Short Rib with jalapeno mashed potatoes.  Everything was excellent taste-wise and presentation-wise.  The portions were just right.

For the dessert we tried the Nutella Creme Brulee (I love Nutella!!!), Salted Caramel Butterscotch Pudding. and McKenna's Brownie which was recommended by our server.  Of course, I'm biased towards anything Nutella so the creme brulee was my favorite without a doubt.  It was creamy and full of Nutella-goodness!  I did have to get rid of half the torched sugar on top though - it didn't need it.  I'm not a fan of butterscotch so the pudding was ok.  The brownie was nothing exciting.

I want to try the duck next time.  And there will be a next time!

Just want to take a few minutes to tell you about one of my favorite eateries in the Vegas Area.  I first went over 10 years ago and we went Wednesday night for my Birthday.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The place is still just as fabulous if not more than years before.  Anything you order is going to be delicious.  Not having a huge menu allows the chef to concentrate on the fare they serve.  I had the duck breast in pomegranit reduction.  My boyfriend had the best meatloaf I have ever tasted.  We started with crab cake app.  I am an International Flight Attendant and have the Blessing to dine all over the world.  Few places stick out in my mind and stay there.  I'm just sorry I stayed away so long.  Won't happen again. Another plus, you can park your ride out front and just walk right in and start a wonderful dining experience sans a casino or a long walk.   Truly one of  The Vegas areas best.  And it's in Henderson, 10 minutes from my house.  Do yourself a favor if you haven't already.  GO!!!!

What can I say Todd is still the best. Located near coyotes Mexican Caf√© and TGI Fridays. Todd's food is consistent and always delicious. You get find dining cuisine without having to pay strip prices and to travel down in traffic. We ordered the beef braised short ribs with jalape√±o mashed potatoes the meet was fall off the fork tender and the mashed potatoes had a slight kick to it.We also got the duck which was cooked perfectly and also the fish of the day delicious.  For dessert we had the berry crumble which was crisp and sweet. We also ordered the raspberry chocolate cake which was a little disappointing because the raspberry was baked into the cake. We assumed it was raspberry sauce on the side. Nonetheless Todd is still one of my favorites and will always be.

Good food, nice service, quiet restaurant. Unique is a good description of the menu and I say that in a complimentary way.  Personally I enjoyed it but harder on my dining partner.  Menu apparently changes regularly.  Wish there were either more options that stayed regularly on the menu and perhaps rotate in a few new ones.  Another option would be to at least post the menu on your website for that day.  This would be helpful for diners who might have a limited circle of what they are willing to eat. Good for small groups but agree with prior reviews that suggest reservations.  Most entrees are between $21-29 apps are $8-11 and salads are up to $12. Quiet to average atmosphere. Easy to hold a conversation. Booth set up was sort of uncomfortable.  90 degree bench style seat with little padding.

If given the option, I like to dine off Strip, even during restaurant week. Yes, there are big name chefs with big casinos backing them, but to find a charming restaurants is more difficult. 

Todd's does hit some positive notes, but overall it was middle of the road. My reservation was for four people at 5:30. Two of us got there early and was told to sit at the bar until the rest of our party came. I had ordered a Joie De Veev. (Is that even how you spell it?) It is a mixture of muddled strawberries, mint, berry vodka, and ginger ale. The drink is refreshing and would be perfect for summer or Vegas winter.

When everyone showed up, we were sat and greeted promptly. For appetizers; we started with two Grumpy Salads and two Sweet Corn Raviolis. Nothing wow inducing, but edible. The salad was plain and the sauce for the ravioli was rich with no kick. For entrees; two of us got the prime rib of pork, one steelhead, and one beef medallion. Everyone was happy with these dishes. All of the meats were cooked to perfection. For the dessert course; we ordered the chocolate ice cream, hazelnut creme brulee, salted caramel pudding, and the flourless chocolate cake. My favorite was the salted caramel pudding. It had a nice balance. The creme brulee was underwhelming and was the least favorite for the group.

The service was great. It looked like the room worked as a team. We had our waitress, but throughout the meal multiple people stopped by with food, refills and to clear plates. It looked more complex than the basic captain, front waiter, back waiter, food runner combo. Whatever formula it was, it worked.

Just went here for the first time tonight and was NOT disappointed. We live right by the restaurant and have always wondered about it; I highly recommend going here if you've ever wondered about stopping by.

My boyfriend and I started with truffled edamame (yum!), tuna tartare, and bacon wrapped dates. (We ordered off of the happy hour appetizer menu. Everything was so delicious. The edamame was so good, definitely split it because it's a big portion. The tuna tartare was small which makes it great if you are very hungry and intend to order off the main menu as well (which I did). It was really great the mix of textures in the tartare and they could potentially be bite sized depending on the eater. And the bacon wrapped dates, please get them. They are so good and you will love them!

For our entrees, my boyfriend got the short rib. I nabbed a little bite of it and it was tender, juicy, and flavorful. I got the duck with the blueberry sauce and sweet potato. If you love duck, you will love this. It was cooked to perfection and was a great portion; it wasn't enough to make you feel uncomfortably stuffed if you finished the plate. 

We sat at the bar and had a great bartender, Caleb. If you sit at the bar to eat, he's your man. Definitely will be back again soon!

Took a couple here for their 5 year wedding anniversary a few weeks ago. Past experiences have been great, so we were looking forward to the same. 

Service was great as usual with attentive waitstaff and great drinks from the bar. 

The anniversary couple had steak and a dinner salad. I had scallops, which half were perfect and half were undercooked. What really earned the 2 stars though, was the clams with hoisin sauce my wife ordered. Somehow, someway her plate was served with a few unopened clams. Now I have seen varying opinions on eating unopened clams, but why would a fine dining establishment risk it and serve them?

Not sure if we will return, but we really enjoyed meals there in the past.

Yelp 100 Challenge 27

It was about four years ago that we were in town and dined at Todds for the first time.  Tonight we were able to return once again.

Our server Anthony was excellent, very attentive. We started our meal with the fried calamari and aioli dipping sauce. Not sure what was up with the calamari tonight. It seemed as though they were left in the fryer too long, as they were a tad chewy and a little on the greasy side. Additionally, the batter was flavorless. Enough said about the appetizer.

On the other hand our beet salad served on cold plates with golden beets, fennel, mixed greens was delicious.  The dressing was light and didn't weigh down or over power the other ingredients.

My hubby ordered the tuna tartare served with wasabi mashed...excellent! 
The fish was sashimi grade, so very tender and the sauce was equally delicious. I ordered the mahi mahi stuffed with crab and served with mixed veggies. The fish was excellent and the veggies tender crisp. Both entrees were presented beautifully.

As for dessert, we were stuffed so we passed this time.

Ample free parking out front. Reservations helpful on the weekends.

We've dined at Todd's about 5 times over the past 2 years, and every creation Todd has crafted for us has been stellar.  Last night was no different.  Todd's is participating in the Spring Restaurant (Feb 27 - Mar 4), offering a 3 course dinner @ $30.12/person.  I started with the "Grumpy's Salad", which is a delightful mound of chipped lettuce, onions, tomatoes, and blue cheese lightly coated in a creamy dressing.  Because of the texture, the blue cheese sneaks into random bites, which is such a wonderful mid chew surprise!  Other first course options are the Cream of Heirloom Tomato Soup or a Sweet Corn Ravioli.  

Second Course offerings include Roast Prime Rib of Pork, Grilled Steelhead with Meyer Lemon Aioli & Toasted Cous Cous, Filet Medallions in a Wild Mushroom Cabernet Sauce, Vegetable Risotto, or for $20 more they offer a Surf and Turf with a Maine Lobster Tail.  Most everyone at our table ordered the Grilled Steelhead because we had brought a wine pairing that worked best with the fish.  This was my first time ordering Steelhead, which most resembled the texture and tenderness of salmon.  It was absolutely delicious in the light lemon cream sauce.  I  loved the larger sized cous cous they paired.

Most important note: Every Wednesday night Todd's offers free corkage for up to 2 bottles per table!!!

The third course offers way more choices than any of the other restaurant week dining options with 4 dessert choices that ALL sound yummy to my tummy!  Choices include their Flourless Chocolate Cake with Raspberry and Vanilla Sauce, Hazelnut Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e, Salted Butterscotch Pudding topped with Fresh Cream, or an assortment of Housemade Ice Creams.  Since I've ordered their Flourless Chocolate Cake on a few occasions, I went with the Hazelnut Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e.  Absolute melt off your chair goodness!   If you are a hazelnut fan & you love cr√®me br√ªl√©e, then this is a must have.

My only regrets about the whole night were that I didn't place a to-go order for their duck breast that comes in a pomegranate red wine sauce over a sweet potato pur√©e.  This is one of those dishes that food dreams are made of.  Probably one of my top 5 dishes to order in all of Vegas.

I am sure this place was probably good back in its prime days but we were here in January since family and it was mediocre. The Steak was amazing but everything else was so salty, and I am a normally a salty eater. They had salt in the salad... who puts that much salt in a salad or a pasta dish? Sorry for ranting but I hate paying a lot for bad food. I only gave it a 3 as the steak itself was very good. The steak was Cooked perfectly to a medium rare. I wouldn't want to go back though..

This is a hard one to rate. We had a 7:30 reservation and we seated immediately. I have been hearing rave reviews and was quite excited to try this place. I LOVE going to none chain- local places. The waitress came and plopped down the menus and only one wine list. We were a group of 3 women and all wanted something different to drink. The server was not terrible, but for the prices and what I think they want to be she needs a lot of training. To me correct etiquette and flow is what makes a great server. It's all part of a fine dining experience. She boringly rattled off the specials, she didn't really seem to even know for sure what it consisted of. We ordered and when the food arrived she plunked it down on the table like it was IHOP. Really rather annoying. I ordered the steak on fire and a beet salad. Beet salad description said it had grapefruit. I didn't see or taste it, but it was really good (fantastic) anyway. The steak was really good for a few bites. I think all the cheese on the fries was overwhelming. My friend had the same, she said she loved it, but only ate about 3 bites. He daughter had scallops and said she liked it. None of us were raving or swooning over the food. It was good. But def didn't live up to all the hype I have been hearing. Our water was never refilled and that steak was so hot I really wanted water. They also were playing a football game which I found odd and anoying in fine dining and at those prices. But I really got annoyed at the end of the meal. We haven't seen each other in quite awhile and were enjoying catching up. We finished eating at about 9. The waitress dropped off the check and we were talking. She never returned to see if we wanted anything else. They started tearing the bar apart for heavy cleaning at 9. They were banging and clanging away. The lights got brighter as well. Then at about 9:30 it felt like they shut off the air to get rid of us. It was about 200 degrees and the entire place was getting torn down. The hours state open till 10. First of all if the waitress ever came back we wanted to have more drinks, it wasn't time for them to close and there was no one waiting for our table. I could understand we would be a bother if it was time to go home or they needed to turn the table for another reservation. These kind of things are why locally owned places never survive. The whole point is making the guests feel welcome and wanted. Olive Garden next door has a warmer vibe. Also, their website states a $30 PP average. All our entress were $36, plus salad and 2 drinks each the bill was QUITE a bit more pricy. Darn, I was so excited about this one.

I like Todd's a lot the food is always good so is the staff,but they need new booths they are miserably uncomfortable. I've been going there for at least 15 years and I've sat in the same booth 75% of the time and I'd like to take an axe to it. But that would just lead to trouble. I'll continue to suffer because I like the place that much.

Brought my boyfriend here for his birthday. It was delightful. The calamari Ricardo was great. We split a Caesar...no. Our salad was elf sized.i It was good, just EXTREMELY small so for eight bucks I would higly advise against it.. His skirt steak was great and the fries were phenomenal.

I got barramundi in caviar sauce with cous cous.  It was beautiful and had the best texture mix I've ever had. They brought out a todd-a-misu for his birthday which was awesome, and we also ordered bread pudding. Excellent. 

Ive seen others talk about uncomfortable seats and I was afraid, but they must have done some renovating because our booth was way comfortable.

I measure by three different things in comparison to Taco Bell:

DECOR: Located in Henderson, Todd's Unique is in a small plaza sharing a building with other establishments. A bit ironic as externally Taco Bells look nicer than this place!
