However, walking in you find a restaurant that gives off a fancy atmosphere, but not in an overwhelming sense. Patrons dress casually, which is nice. A star for delivering a nice atmosphere.

SERVICE:  The waiters here are dressed up and polite. I'd say they deliver the same service that you'd expect in a five star establishment! More upscale service than your average Taco Bell establishment for sure! Another star!

FOOD: I started off with the Goats Cheese with Raspberry Basil Sauce as an appetizer. I have to say while this was delicious it was sweet enough that I think it would rather be better as a dessert. I don't recommend this as an appetizer, again too sweet. My main entree was the Lamb 2 ways. I always enjoy a good lamb, however while it was good it wasn't mind blowing. Since the overall the food was just okay, only one star here.

FINAL VERDICT: Is Taco Bell better? Yes

Look you're in Henderson, which means you're just miles away from the Las Vegas Strip. There are a ton of better sophisticated restaurants if that's what you're looking for. However if it's been a long night in Vegas and you're looking for some chow, Taco Bell would work as well.

My short ribs were tender, succulent and tasty. My lady's diver scallops were perfectly prepared with a garnish of pistachio potatoes. Our friends raved about their entrees. We shared goat cheese won ton, and lobster Sui Mai apps, as well as a decadent brownie and flourless chocolate cake. With cocktails $200, or $50pp. Great value, with attentive service

Came here again for a regular dinner, which was outstanding.  This is literally my husband's favorite restaurant.  I love it but I hate saying "ok this is my absolute favorite and nothing else compares to it."  But as others have said (echoing Adina M and Trina T), this restaurant really blows others out of the water and is more of an experience than a meal.

I had heard that John Curtas of Eating Las Vegas thought Todd's dumplings were Chinese worthy restaurant dumplings and assuming were insanely good, we tried those because my other choice, the tuna would have to be eaten by me alone since my non fish-eating husband wouldn't touch it.  They were executed perfectly, better than the asian places I have had them before (which isn't much sadly).  We also split the beet salad which was incredibly fresh with a horseradish dressing.  My non horseradish-loving husband really loved this, as the dressing did not overwhelm the good fresh vegetables and the grapefruit.

I was full at this point but we also had the skirt steak on fire and the hanger steak in cognac sauce.  My skirt steak was the most flavorful I've ever had in my life, much better than the skirt steak I've had in strip restaurants (Tom Coliccio should send his Craftsteak chefs to Todd to learn how to properly cook and cut skirt steak, seriously).  While I'm not a huge fan of hanger steak, the sauce was pretty incredible.  My husband though kept eating my skirt steak and liked it better, thank god because I could barely finish half of it.

I also want to point out that they serve this saffron beer which I just can't remember the same of.  It was really incredible and now I want to get a hold of some of it.  It had an odd name, so if anyone out there knows the name of the saffron beer they serve, please let me know what it is!  One of the best I have had ever.

Dinner for two, with drinks, was only around $90ish dollars, which was a steal for this kind of level of food. The food here really surpasses all three of the Michelin Star restaurants I have been to in Vegas.

Great local restuarant that can easily compete with any place on The Strip! Food is always fantastic, service is excellent and ambiance is just what you look for in a restaurant. Always enjoy our trip to Todd's and look forward to visiting again real soon!

Made a reservation for my first time trying this place.  Wanted to go have a nice dinner with my boyfriend for our date night.  Arrived early and was extremely underwhelmed with the decor/interior.  The hostess immediately explained that due to a large walk in party, I would not be able to be seated on time.  She then walked me to the bar and said "when our servers are available, then we will seat you at a table".  OK.... so we sit at the bar and order martinis- which were very overpriced considering this is in a strip mall OFF the strip ($13) We sit and wait for over 20 minutes before deciding that this is ridiculous and discuss where we should go instead since we wanted to catch a show we already bought tickets for.  The bartender overhears, and then grabs the hostess and she tries to "convince" us to stay, but then promises that our food WON'T be ready in time for our movie.... but we should stay anyway.  What a joke.  Horrible first impression, unimpressive service, and overpriced.  I will NOT be giving them a second chance.
This is another good gourmet restaurant off the strip in a strip mall.

Do not let the strip mall location deter you from dining here.   This is a romantic little local place with excellent food.  

Our server was a bit dull but the quality of the food more than made up for it.  Very well presented and delivered timely.  All the dishes we ordered were fine and devoured in short order. 

I would call this place a hidden gem but is facing Sunset Blvd so it is not very hidden.   If you are looking for a quiet dinner spot with your significant other, this place won't disappoint.
Been to Todd's a few times and the food is always amazing. Friendly staff and an eclectic menu. Don't worry, if it sounds odd, it's probably really good. We will be back.

My husband and I went here for our anniversary dinner. He was a little skeptical because he had never heard of it.  Service was outstanding and attentive. Goat cheese wonton appetizer was amazing! We had two different salads, both were very fresh and flavors were amazing! We had the two specials- a sword fish and a steak! Both were amazing! Definitely will come back. Highly, highly recommend. My husband is now a believer!

Such a hidden gem! I have wanted to dine here for so long, but had not made it until recently.

My BF and I had date night and this restaurant was his choice because it's a longtime favorite of his. He made reservations the same day and we were both pretty excited.

The location and decor are nothing special, but the food and service are phenomenal. I had the scallops and they were fantastic. They also have a great wine list - we just ended up with a bottle of Moet, since we both ordered seafood.

This could be a romantic date, but there is also a bar where you could be more casual. I look forward to going to one of their wine dinners soon.

Thank you Yelpers!  Located across from an Olive Garden is this hidden gem.  The place was right off the street in a strip mall, and I still missed it. 

I had the duck, and it was amazing.  I'd go back just for that.  My bf had the braised short rib, and he raved how tender it was.  The jalapeno mashed was good, and wasn't over powering.

The bread pudding was wonderful, but my only sad part was the coffee after my meal.  It was weak.  That was disappointing after a delightful meal and didn't compliment the dessert.  Otherwise, thumbs up!
This is a great date night restaurant. It is Vegas quality fine dining in our neighborhood

Time for an update since I've gotten several visits in. The last one I invited some friends to join for happy hour. There were 4 of us on a Friday evening 5pm. We ordered, we ate, we had a good time. At the time of the bill, we noted that Happy Hour prices were not in effect for our table. The waiter informed us that Happy Hour only applies to the bar, which was basically 5 feet away from our table. There are probably 6 tables in the bar area, and the other side of the restaurant has more. This seemed a bit hokey to me, because we could have easily sat at the bar to get 1/2 off wine, of which my friends ordered 3-4 glasses each of. 

I had the grilled pork chop and I found the flavor to be a bit lacking in the peach jalapeno sauce. The chop itself was very thick, and almost seemed a little undercooked. I wasn't impressed with this selection. Two had the coconut crusted mahi and they loved it, as did I on my first visit. The sea scallops were my other friends choice and he enjoyed them as well. 

So now I know Happy Hour only applies to the 9 seats at the bar. I guess I won't get the luxury of bringing friends with me to this fine dining establishment.
Great seafood & steaks.  Great value for the quality of food.  Sign up for their newsletter & you will get coupons & updates on wine dinners (which are fabulous).

It was Restaurant Week, and at long last I was slated to step inside Todd's Unique Dining Restaurant and evaluate it for myself.  Our reservations were acknowledged and quickly honored, and not a moment too soon.  For, several parties arrived just after us.  The place was quickly packed with people and frantic servers.  But, initially, ours did not move fast enough.  Although our server said she would get us set with water and bread, she next took orders from an adjoining table of 11 diners instead.  When, after hailing a busser, our bread basket did finally arrive, it contained very good raisin bread but there was nothing special about the white bread.  The ambiance was homey but, as other Yelpers have previously noted, our straightback booth was rather cramped and uncomfortable.  

A bowl of Cream of Heirloom Tomato Soup was very good.  Unusual Sweet Corn Ravioli tasted pretty good.  And, Grumpy's Salad turned out to be like a chopped wedge salad.  The medium-rare Filet Medallions I was served were excellent and buttery but very peppery, although I got used to the spice.  The Wild Mushroom Cabernet Sauce ladled under it tasted good.  So did Mashed Potatoes.  While a tomato on my plate was perfectly cooked, lengths of carrot served wild rabbit-style were too hard for my taste and julienned red beets accompanying Roast Prime Rib of Pork with Sausage Stuffing were undercooked.  I found Mexican Squash and Enoki Mushrooms to be pleasant but unremarkable.

I thought "Todd's" etched in cocoa powder was a nice visual touch next to a great-tasting Flourless Chocolate Cake with excellent Rasbperry and Vanilla Sauce.  The array of desserts (also Hazelnut Creme Brulee, Salted Butterscotch Pudding with fresh cream, and housemade ice cream) was the highlight of the meal.  While the food did not transport me, it and the overall experience were very good, and a return trip is likely in my future.

Took my wife here for Valentines day. 
On recommendations from other Yelp reviewers, we opted for the to start our dinner with Crab Cakes and the Goat cheese wontons. We also ordered the house salad, watermelon martinis, Scallop entree, the duck entree and a brownie dessert. 
Now the reason for the three stars.
We were seated and given enough time to order without feeling rushed, but once we ordered, we sat and waited and waited and waited. Other tables were given bread to snack on while they waited but not us. 
About thirty minutes later we finally had to ask for bread in order to get something to snack on while we continued to wait.
All the time we sat and waited we had to listen to some apparently drunk loud lady dropping F-bombs non stop. Even the server serving that table heard the lady multiple times but nothing was said.
At this point our romantic night was shot. Seriously, if i wanted to hear loud, drunk, obnoxious people slurring incoherent sentences plagued with F this, mother F'er that, then I could have gone to Applebees or Fridays or Red Lobster. 
When we finally got our appetizers, the wontons barely had any of the raspberry sauce, the wonton wrappers were  not crispy at all and the texture was like they were precooked waiting for someone to order them and then quickly microwaved to get the cheese warm, because they were chewy. The crab cake was cool in the center and not from sitting there on a counter waiting to be picked up but just from not being cooked long enough. 
Did we eat the appetizers or send them back???
We ate them, because at this point it had been about forty minutes just waiting to get them and we haven't even got our salad yet either.
The entrees were very good though. 
The Scallops were cooked perfectly, the risotto was on point, the duck was amazing, but again, no matter how good the food is, the F-bombs coming from the other table were enough to destroy the mood.

The question is would we come back.
Truthfully I am not sure and I have to ask myself, were the issues with the appetizers related to the amount of covers and overwhelmed kitchen staff or did the station chef just not care or pay attention?
Was the issue with the possibly drunk, loud obnoxious F-bomb dropping lady and issue with untrained dining room staff, or did the dining room staff not care and were only concerned with potential tip earnings for the night?

Then short ribs were as good as advertised but otherwise the experience fell short.   The decor is REALLY dated and food was so-so.  A party of 4 spent $400 with $150 of that in wine.   Our sweet potatoes samosas seemed right from the freezer, flatbread was underwhelming and salads were average at best.  

Perhaps an okay spot if you're not wanting to impress someone but for a business meal, I should have stuck with more of a sure thing.

I was excited to finally try Todd's. I was disappointed, the consensus of our group was that it was just OK. Our biggest complaint was that it is SO NOISY inside. It is a small crowded main dining area and we had a hard time hearing each other. 

I will list what we ordered and what we thought of the dishes.

Goat cheese wontons- We felt they were slightly under cooked and a little greasy. The flavor was nice though. 

Chipotle calamari- The calamari itself was very bland. You had to use the spicy chipotle sauce to get any flavor. 

Grumpy's salad- Again it was very bland, it had dressing but you could not tell what kind as there was no flavor. The only thing I tasted was the blue cheese. 

The famous short ribs- I thought they were pretty good. Nice flavor and cooked until very tender. 

The seared ahi dish and mahi mahi were good however pretty small portions. The service was very good throughout the night. I think when they get their fresh halibut and king crab I would like to give Todd's another try. Maybe it was an off night in the kitchen?
50+ crowd. Decorated like grandmas house. Food was decent but not particularly "unique."

First time eating at Todd's. 
It was an interesting set up. I almost felt more like I was in a coffee shop.
The service was great.
We ordered a crab cake appetizer...it could have been a bit crispier, but tasted good.
We shared a Grumpy's salad. The waitress heard we were sharing and split it for us, nice...but my husband's plate got all of the blue cheese crumbles. 
I had the seared scallops with mushroom mashed potatoes...absolutely delicious.
My husband had the mahi mahi stuffed crab, he thoroughly enjoyed it.
Although the food was great, somehow the ambiance made me not want to return...I'm not exactly sure why.
